job1: Data Analyst - News Partnerships, Media Partnerships
desc: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.Facebook is seeking an experienced data and research professional to provide data driven insights around how News media partners can leverage Facebook's products to perform successfully. The position will drive key strategic data initiatives and market analysis, as well as providing actionable recommendations around optimizing partners performance in the News ecosystem. The role will be part of our News Partner Solutions team and is based at the Facebook New York. Responsibilities:Drive research and measurement strategy and manage prioritization of initiatives across internal and external stakeholdersBe able to interpret data and structure analyses to identify trends and actionable insights to drive strategic partnerships and industry communicationsBuild/maintain reports, dashboards and metrics to monitor the team's key performance indicatorsWork with global team to scale programsDeliver insights and make recommendations to partnersWork closely with Partner Solutions Managers and Strategic Partner Managers to educate and act as a consultant for internal stakeholders, scale data analysis in the regionAbility to analyze data to tell a story and make recommendationsQuery internal data and provide ongoing reporting/analysis about News partners and ecosystem performance for new product launches or company prioritiesBuild dashboards to support News Media Partnerships, both within the US and globallyAnalyze and segment partners to better understand our ecosystem and allocate resourcesCreate and manage data pipelines to aggregate data for News Media Partnerships teamManage requests and priorities while creating presentations for internal use with cross-functional teamsWork with other analysts to understand how major media publishers, journalists, and the News industry are using Facebook and Instagram to connect and share with people around the worldMininum Qualifications:BA/BS degree or higher5+ years experience, including leading research/measurement projectsExperience working in Hadoop/Hive, SQL and Excel to drive analysis and reporting of trendsExperience working independently and a track record of taking initiativeCommunication and presentation experienceExperience thinking strategically about issues, leading to recommendations and action plansExperience working cross-functionally with all levels of management, both internally and externallyPreferred Qualifications:Understanding of Tableau or similar software and experience with a statistical programming language (R, python, etc.)Understanding of Comscore and other digital analytics toolsExperience in a consumer technology and/or media company

job1: Specialist Analyst Data Scientist - Technology, Consulting - Insight Studio - UG - Northwestern University (Summer/Fall)
desc: While analytics  isn't new, we're experiencing a renaissance in the science, technology, and  application of business analytics. Many business leaders need to know how best  to quickly understand what their analytics can actually deliver. Our InsightStudio  team works with clients to discover new insights by transforming data into  intuitive, interactive visualizations—such as maps, charts, and dashboards—that  can help leaders see and explore their data in new ways. We need someone with  creative problem solving skills to tackle the challenges our clients present across  a broad range of industry domains. Work  you’ll do We are looking for  people who relish the opportunity to think creatively and outside the box and  enjoy working in collaborative teams. As a Data Scientist, you’ll take part in  building the next generation of InsightStudio solutions and prototypes using  advanced analytics and statistical modeling techniques. You will work in a  cross-functional environment with designers, developers, and business domain  specialists in applying advanced analytics techniques and algorithms, and you  will implement your ideas in real-world solutions and have the chance to  tangibly evaluate and validate your improvements and see the impact on our  clients. In addition to experience and familiarity with core data science  programming, the ideal candidate is someone who thrives on collaborative teams,  understands data science’s impact on business, and can help demystify it to our  clients. This person should have hands-on project/research experience with  machine learning techniques, good understanding of machine learning theory, and  a very high attention to detail. The  team InsightStudio brings the best of Deloitte Consulting’s analytics  assets, solutions, and talent into one, easy to engage, creative environment.  In order to jumpstart  efforts and rapidly deliver impacts that build our clients’ analytics maturity.  The InsightStudio can help grow a client’s analytics maturity whether they are  just starting to explore the possibilities of analytics efforts, beginning to  develop customizable solutions for certain divisions, or scaling capabilities  enterprise-wide. Our product offerings fit together, and complement one  another, to provide clients a pathway towards becoming an Insight Driven  Organization. The team serves as a global center of excellence for data  analytics and visualization. Learn  more about the InsightStudio. Qualifications • Bachelor’s degree completed by Summer 2020 in one of the following disciplines: computer science, statistics, mathematics, physics, or a closely related field  • Limited immigration sponsorship may be available  • Strong academic track record (preferred GPA of 3.5 or higher)  • Programming experience, ideally in Python, or another high-level programming/ scripting language  • Experience with R, database design, and SQL  • Ability to travel up to 50% How  you’ll grow The two most important tools in today’s  business world are experience and education. At Deloitte, you’ll find plenty of  both. Your first years will provide you with education, experience, and  opportunities that can help you to build your future. Our learning programs are  designed to develop your skills in four key areas — technical, professional,  industry, and leadership. You’ll also have access to a career roadmap that can  help you fully leverage the opportunities you need to succeed. Our teams  deliver engaging learning and networking opportunities virtually, in your local  office, and at Deloitte University. Along the way, you’ll have access to  mentoring, counseling, and training opportunities to help foster and accelerate  your development of new skills and capabilities. Learn more about  Deloitte University. Benefits At Deloitte, we know  that great people make a great company. We value our people and offer employees  a broad range of benefits. Learn  more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you. Deloitte’s culture At Deloitte, our culture values leadership and innovation. We  celebrate the value each individual is able to bring to our clients and our  culture. We believe that collaboration is a key to opportunity and  success. We empower and support our  people in the daily choices they must make to be healthy, confident and  centered. Learn more about Life at Deloitte. Corporate citizenship Ours is a culture of purpose. At Deloitte,  we believe that business has the power to inspire, transform, and drive change.  We focus on education, community outreach, and skill-based volunteerism. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on  community.Recruiter tips At Deloitte, we want our potential candidates to  feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that  you do your research: know some background about the company and the business  area you’re applying to. We also suggest that you brush up on your behavioral  and case interviewing skills and practice discussing your experience and job  history with a family member, friend, or mentor. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals to  help you prepare.As used in this posting, “Deloitte” means Deloitte Consulting LLP, a subsidiary of Deloitte LLP. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. Certain services may not be available to attest clients under the rules and regulations of public accounting.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.  Requisition code: S20NWUCF21AUUPB-T

BuzzFeed is looking for an analyst to join the data team and lead a set of important initiatives that will ensure the robustness and availability of data in our warehouse, shape our understanding of how readers use our products, and drive our longer term product strategy. We're seeking passionate professionals who have a proven track record using data in a meaningful way, informing decision making, and driving the continued growth and success of a product. You balance technical expertise, domain knowledge and a capacity to be deeply inquisitive.  BuzzFeed's data team is diverse. The team uses data-driven methods to power decisions, inform strategy, build robust data products, and identify opportunities for innovation across the company. We are true hybrids - analysts, statisticians, and domain experts- who specialize in translating questions into methodical approaches, experiments, and products. We think deeply about the limitations of data, and communicate our output coherently. You WillMake strategic and systematic recommendations and investments in improving overall data quality and governance.Collaborate closely with data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and data PMs to implement the BuzzFeed data model, and advance our cross-departmental data governance initiative.Facilitate data integration, data quality, and integrity.Create and maintain critical documentation and metadata that allows data to be understood and leveraged across teams.Articulate and implement the strategy and repeatable processes for maintaining the BuzzFeed data model.Advise and shape product direction with data by delivering exploratory data analyses, designing and analyzing experiments, and defining and monitoring key metrics.Develop KPIs in a cross-platform world, balancing measures of engagement and revenue.Support development of data tooling, such as forecasts, anomaly detection, and our home-grown A/B testing platform.Communicate complex ideas in a clear way to partners across the company.Develop domain expertise in a specific product area.You HaveGood grasp of statistical concepts (e.g. hypothesis testing, regression)Proficiency with SQL.Experience with social data or media is a plus.Proficiency with Python.Experience with Looker is a plus.Life at BuzzFeed At BuzzFeed, we believe our work benefits from the diverse perspectives of our employees. As such, BuzzFeed celebrates inclusion and is committed to equal opportunity employment. As a BuzzFeed employee, you can expect: A supportive, inclusive atmosphere on a team that values your contributionsOpportunities for personal and professional growth via work experience, offerings from our in-house Learning Team, Employee Resource Groups, and moreAn attractive compensation package, including salary and equityA generous and well-rounded benefits program featuring PTO and unlimited sick time, comprehensive medical benefits, a family leave policy, access to mental health platforms, retirement plans, gym and wellness discounts, and much moreNo shortage of snacks, catered lunches, beverages, birthday treats... even leftovers from the Tasty kitchens in LA and NYC!

Job Location:Corporate New York CityABOUT SIMON VENTURES  Simon Ventures is the venture capital affiliate of Simon Property Group (Simon), an S&P 100 company as well as the largest publicly traded real estate investment trust in the S&P 500. Simon Ventures specializes in investing in next generation commerce as well as the retail technologies that power or optimize for those consumer experiences with CB Insights most recently recognizing Simon Ventures as one of the 10 most active investors in retail technology.  Simon Ventures can serve as a unique investment partner to founders by leveraging Simon's operational platform and access to market distribution channels to impact the slope and velocity of their growth while supporting their continued creative and shareholder control. This service proposition resonates with founders who are looking for a partner that can strategically amplify their abilities to create value and capitalize on unfair market advantage. PRIMARY PURPOSE The analyst role will be based in New York City. As an analyst you will have an opportunity to learn the venture capital business, including the fundamentals of asset allocation and the process of selecting high quality investments using both quantitative and qualitative analysis to support due diligence efforts, and gain insight into many fascinating startups that are innovating at the intersection of retail and technology. You will also contribute to building an investment platform that is focused on leveraging the best in assets across real estate, technology, brands and social influence to offer a service proposition to founders that is uniquely differentiated for venture capital.  The primary role of the analyst is to support the Managing Director, including due diligence and active portfolio management (including assisting and supporting portfolio companies with operational initiatives). Core duties include the following:  • Supporting deal origination efforts, including performing market research relating to investment trends, global market environments and analysis of bench-marking and comparative statistics  • Supporting the Managing Director in a variety of analytic and investment management activities, including running due diligence for potential investments and assisting in the preparation of IC memos and presentations  • Working with and supporting portfolio companies, including with the activation of any operational initiatives, research projects, competitor analysis, valuation work and board meeting support  • Conducting valuation updates and monitoring performance across the existing portfolio  • Helping with the coordination and production of regular reporting for IC review, including quarterly updates and other reports      THE IDEAL CANDIDATEEducation & Experience: • Bachelor’s degree and one to three years of investment banking, finance, investment management, start up or retail operating experience  • Demonstrated ability to execute detailed financial analysis  • Proficiency in MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint  • Strong writing skills Knowledge Skills and Abilities: • Interest in next generation commerce and retail technology  • Critical thinker, intellectually curious, detail-oriented and unafraid to ask questions  • Driven to work hard within a high performance environment with ability to work across a number of investments and projects simultaneously, sometimes on tight deadlines  • Strong technical/quantitative skills  • Strong fit within a team oriented, no ego, intellectually curious culture  • Strong interpersonal skills  #ZR

At Rockstar Games, we create the games we would want to play ourselves.  A career at Rockstar is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding, large-scale projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a friendly, inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.  Rockstar New York is seeking an experienced data analyst to join our growing Analytics practice and help build Rockstar's business intelligence capacity. Successful candidates will work with analytics and product leadership to assure that the most relevant possible real-time and historical data is identified, tracked, analyzed, and made actionable across all of our titles. This is a full-time permanent position based out of Rockstar's unique game development studio in the heart of downtown Manhattan. WHAT WE DOThe Rockstar Analytics team provide insights and actionable results to a wide variety of stakeholders across the organization in support of their decision making.We work together with a number of departments to design and implement data and pipelines.We collaborate as a global team to develop cutting-edge data pipelines, data products, data models, reports, analyses and machine learning applications.RESPONSIBILITIESPartner with analysts and live producers to identify strategic business questions, key metrics, and actionable insights.Provide consumer-ready recommendations, insights and reporting to Analytics team leadership, live producers, product managers and partner groups.Effectively translate statistical findings into actionable recommendations for senior leaders on game and business teams.Research and develop state-of-the-art data mining and statistical modeling solutions to understand game design, system performance and key business behaviors, such as player engagement.Drive needle moving improvements via hands-on exploration of data, dashboards, statistical analysis and predictive modeling.Combine qualitative and quantitative driven insights with game knowledge to recommend potential avenues to the game and business teams.Drive requirements for data collection and for data modeling with data engineersWork within a team of data analysts and engineers.QUALIFICATIONS5+ years in a similar position or an analytics role in the marketing, finance, forensics, or technology fields.Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operational Research, Business Intelligence or any other relevant field).Graduate degree (MBA, MSc or master's, PHD), an asset.Extensive knowledge of data analysis techniques, languages, software and systems (SAS, R, Matlab, Python, SPSS, Tableau) required.Extensive knowledge in SQL (or a SQL-like language) required.Experience with Vertica and Hadoop, an asset.Game industry experience strongly desired.SKILLSStory telling.Ability to develop and maintain good relations and communicate with people at all hierarchical levels.Strong problem-solving skills.Ability to reconcile technical and business perspectives.Autonomy and entrepreneurship.Strong team spirit.Passion for Rockstar Games and our titles.HOW TO APPLY Please apply with a CV and cover-letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.  Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.  If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race.SDL2017

New YorkVIRTU As a leading financial technology firm, we leverage cutting-edge technology to deliver liquidity to global markets as well as innovative, transparent trading solutions and industry standard-setting analytics tools to our clients. As a market maker, Virtu provides deep liquidity that helps to create more efficient markets around the world. Virtu offers a dynamic, meritocratic environment with a flat hierarchy. No finance background is necessary or expected. This is a great opportunity for the right candidate to kick start a career in the financial technology space. THE ROLE Market Data Analyst will be supporting the team with the maintenance of FITS (Financial Information Tracking System) as well as supporting the business needs for adding, canceling and re-assigning market data services across teams. As a Market Data Analyst, the role will provide an opportunity to learn and expand into other areas of the business accounting and vendor management. A successful candidate will have the ability to work across broad, diverse groups; demonstrates the ability to collaborate and develop/maintain relationships within both the Firm and Vendors. The candidate will be a highly motivated and tenacious individual, with a proven ability to take initiative and work independently and within a team. Contribute to the day-to-day management of all Market Data services which includes vendor managementContribute to the maintenance of FITS (Financial Information Tracking System) inventoryProcess requests to add, cancel or re-assign services due to moves, departures or change in business requirementsObtain cost approvals and process orders in compliance with contract terms & conditionsContribute to the management of all aspects of the market data contract and invoice lifecycles (Receipt, reconciliation, renewal)Support monthly Accounting and Management reportingContribute to the search for cost reductions and savingsTHE CANDIDATE2 + years of experience in a related environmentFamiliarity with general accounting and financial concepts in order to provide accurate accounting of expensesProficient utilization of MS OFFICE products especially ExcelExperience with market data management applications (i.e. FITS, MDMS, etc.)Very strong written and verbal communication skillsSelf-discipline, attention to detail and a focus on resultsBachelor’s degree (BSc/BA)YOU’RE JUST RIGHT IF YOU WANT:A smaller team environmentA great place for upward and geographic mobilityDirect exposure to the decision makers and senior leaders on all sides of the businessThe energetic dynamism of financial marketsTeams that are passionate about continually learning, improving and raising the barA community that values hard work as well as work-life balanceA company that is committed to giving back to surrounding communities, from LA to Hong Kong and Sydney and the 11 locations in between

Position Summary The Data and Research Analyst develops, manages, and maintains reports and various data-driven processes and applications for analysis related to admissions, academics and financial reporting for the School of General Studies. Working primarily in SQL, the incumbent will use various data sources to perform analysis, assessment, and reporting while supporting data integrity and security. As an integral member of the team, the analyst will assist with data mining, research design, and strategic goals and objectives around analytics and data. Responsibilities Innovation: Create, maintain, and document innovative, user-friendly front-end reporting tools and platforms that provide point-and-click ability to produce reports for operational and analytical needs. Build and maintain databases and automate data processes, including ETL, SQL, stored procedures, crystal reports and enterprise business objects, etc., for in-house and third-party databases.  Reporting: Provide data and reports for federal and institutional research and annual reporting needs. Respond quickly to user requests received via the internal ticketing system and provide ad-hoc reports and datasets in response to requests from various departments.  Process improvement: Provide quantitative and qualitative analysis and feedback for research, surveys, and assessments; help facilitate design, execution, and reporting on research findings for use in strategic planning and policy development/implementation. Create framework for forecasting and modeling projects.  Data Quality Management: Identify data quality issues and work with appropriate stakeholders to devise and implement systematic solutions.  Documentation: Maintain meticulous documentation in the form of code and solutions for other analysts as well as explainer details for end users of data resources.  Communication: Quickly assess user needs and translate into clear and concise data requirements to ensure data and reports are provided in a timely fashion  Collaboration: Develop quality control systems to determine risks to identify database discrepancies and work collaborative with operational staff to execute reconciliation activities  Project Management: work with team members to plan short- and long-term projects, and participate in implementing strategic initiatives around research, forecasting, analysis, and reporting.  Other related duties as assigned. Minimum Qualifications + Bachelor's degree or equivalent required. A minimum of 3 years of related experience, or combination of education and experience. The ability to work with a high degree of independence and accountability as a member of a cohesive team. Excellent verbal and written communications skills. Proficiency in SQL, query and reporting analysis tools. Familiarity with relational database design. Proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel. Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks under short and changing deadlines, while ensuring timely and accurate execution. Proven ability to create project plans and successfully complete projects. Excellent analytical, organizational, and interpersonal skills required; ability to analyze and interpret complex data sets, make findings relevant, and explain data and technology to a general (non-technical) audience. Act as an analytical thinker with the ability to work collaboratively and independently. Must have the ability to exercise sound judgment, discretion and tact in a highly confidential professional setting.  Preferred Qualifications  Experience with enterprise-level reporting tools is preferred.  Knowledge of an object-oriented language such as Python or R.  Experience with both qualitative and quantitative statistical methods in survey design, research, or assessments is preferred.  Experience using student information systems (SIS) and/or high-level enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems  Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran  Columbia University is committed to the hiring of qualified local residents.

DESCRIPTION:The Manager, Data Governance works collaboratively with the Director, Metadata Management to support efforts to develop SHOWTIME's Data Governance program working with a wide range of internal stakeholders.  This position will lead and support the company's Data Governance initiative and its key stakeholders by capturing, compiling and documenting Data Governance policies, procedures, best practices & recommendations created during Data Governance working group meetings.  The person in this role will assist in developing and implementing metadata standards as it related to Data Governance to ensure accuracy and completeness of daily published metadata, with the goal of enhancing marketing effectiveness and brand consistency for Showtime programs and services across platforms.  In addition to diving deep into the details, the person in this role will also be an advocate for Data Governance across all departments in the company which play a role in the metadata supply chain.  Principal Responsibilities  • Lead & project manage data governance stakeholder and working group meetings consisting of cross-functional internal stakeholders, including Business Affairs, Program Operations & Distribution, Acquisitions, Creative Services, Broadcast Operations, Sports Group, Digital Media, Scheduling & Programming, Product Development, Research & IT.  • Consult with key stakeholders to collaboratively establish recommendations to streamline approach and implement ongoing metadata best practices  • Define and control project scope, goals and objectives, project schedules, reporting metrics, communications plan, issues and risk management.  • Capture and document current data flows along with proper data governance practices, policies, procedures and recommendations discussed at Data Governance meetings.  • Assist in building and maintaining centralized data inventories, data dictionaries and data flows as it pertains to Data Governance  • Identify gaps within internal data landscape to ensure data integrity and data structure compliance within data governance frameworks  • Present solutions to maximize data governance policy adoption and recommend leveraging existing technologies to automate processes when applicable.  • Create, contribute and manage internal metadata policies with accompanying best practice documentation  • Manage the publication and communication plan of the data governance polices to ensure all the data consumers are aware of the data governance strategies and any changes  • At Director's discretion, act as a department point person for identified workflows, attend intra-company meetings and be secondary level of contact for internal stakeholders  • Support Director in strategic planning of all initiatives related to data governance management.  • Anticipate business needs, identify risks and opportunities, and recommends solutions to senior management. QUALIFICATIONS: • Master of Library Science or Information Science - a plus  • 3-5 years of primary experience in defining, documenting and implementing Data Governance best practices, policies & procedures  • Demonstrated success working with digital asset management solutions in an enterprise marketing organizations or media companies.  • Experience working successfully with stakeholders and partner teams to translate business needs into taxonomy solutions.  • Attention to detail, critical thinking skills, excellent communication and interpersonal skills, the ability to work independently with an entrepreneurial spirit and collaborate cross-functionally with many departments within an organization.  • IBMS experience - a plus  • Excellent written and oral communication skills and a passion for subject.  • Strong project managing & presentation skills  • Organizational and multitasking skills a must  • Candidate should have a successful track record coordinating resources from different functional organizations, documenting processes as well as understanding and documenting business and workflow requirements.

About Cubist  Cubist Systematic Strategies is one of the world’s premier investment firms. The firm deploys systematic, computer-driven trading strategies across multiple liquid asset classes, including equities, futures and foreign exchange. The core of our effort is rigorous research into a wide range of market anomalies, fueled by our unparalleled access to a wide range of publicly available data sources. Job Description We are passionate about data. We collaborate to build elegant, effective, scalable and highly reliable solutions to empower predictive modelling in finance.  Cubist’s Data Services group is looking for a Data Support Analyst to join our dedicated team. Our group is responsible for the timely delivery of comprehensive and error-free data to some of the most demanding and successful systematic Portfolio Managers in the world.  This exceptional individual will be a member of a small team of Data Scientists and Analysts who play a vital role in ensuring the smooth day-to-day implementation of a large research infrastructure, and the live production trading of billions of dollars of capital across global capital markets, including equities, futures, options and other financial instruments.  Job Responsibilities Provide day-to-day support for various operational proceduresProject lifecycle management to help the team support PM teams seamlesslyManage calendar and conference call schedule, make appointments, organize meetings and occasionally take and maintain meeting minutesAssist Data team with interoffice travel arrangements, expenses etc.Assist in organizing presentationsInteract with vendors on a daily basisCoordinate with compliance team and legal team on new vendor trial/subscription processAssist with collecting and maintaining overviews and vendor content offeringDownload trial datasets from vendor FTP sites or other delivery mechanism Desirable Candidates Bachelor’s degree required.Strong PowerPoint, Visio, Word, and Excel skills. Access is a plus.Financial industry experience preferred but not required.Strong oral and written communication skills.Excellent interpersonal skills; we seek a demonstrated ability to build relationships both internally and externally.Attention to detail and a love of process.Ability to exercise sound judgment in assessing and determining how to handle queries, calls and issues.Ability to independently manage multiple long-term and short-term projects simultaneously.

Healthcare Data AnalystElite Technical is seeking a Healthcare Data Analyst for our client in New York, NY. The Healthcare Data Analyst will work with analytics, customer support, business development and the clinical teams to update existing and develop new fee schedules and payment rates for State Workers Compensation programs. The individual will serve as a subject matter expert for each of the state based schedules and will be responsible for all associated statistical methodologies to create the reimbursement models. Knowledge of Center for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Medicare fee schedule and state Workers- Compensation fee schedules is required. This position will be responsible for researching and creating models to help determine reimbursement values based on specified criteria. Responsibilities include the design, development, updating and deployment of multiple state fee schedules.  The Healthcare Data Analyst will write programs to import current fee schedules, perform statistical analyses, including providing comparisons to older fee schedules, Medicare rates and other state fees schedules and to generate new fee schedules. In addition, the Healthcare Data Analyst will export the new fee schedules into a format which can be directly incorporated into regulations and state fee schedule rules and guidelines.  This is a fulltime, direct opportunity with our client, who is offering a generous salary & benefits package allowing for career stability and professional growth. Please contact Elite Technical to learn more about this exciting opportunity.Required Skills- Knowledge of CMS and third-party fee schedules Understanding of healthcare claims payment methodologies, and claims editing policiesFamiliarity with health plan claims adjudication systems and interdependent applicationsStrong experience and knowledge of SAS, SAS BASE, SAS SQL, SAS Macros, SAS toolsExcellent written and verbal communication skills.Analytic, problem solving, technical skills and attention to detail are requiredStrong interpersonal skills, including the ability to work in a highly cross-functional, multi-location organizationComprehensive knowledge of MS Office Suite of Products including Excel and PowerPointApply Now

job1: Data Analyst/Data Scientist (2020 Start) - Analytics - Multioffice
desc: Data Analyst and Data Scientist - New York, NY, Summit, NJ or San Francisco, CA About Charles River Associates Charles River Associates is a leading global consulting firm that provides independent economic and financial analysis behind litigation matters, guides businesses through critical strategy and operational issues to become more profitable, and advises governments on the economic impact of policies and regulations. Our two main services – litigation and management consulting – are delivered by practice groups that focus on specific areas of expertise or industries. Learn more about how CRA can help you Accelerateyour career.  CRA's Life Sciencespractice helps pharmaceutical, biotechnology, diagnostics and medical device companies achieve optimum performance across key aspects of their business, including innovation, commercial success, organization, and reputation, all for the long-term benefit of patients, clinicians, employees, and shareholders. We work with life sciences businesses directly as well as with their legal counsel, industry associations, government organizations, and advocacy groups from the earliest stages of research into new therapy areas, through product development, to the delivery of products that will achieve commercial success and fulfill the expectations of our clients and their key stakeholders. Essential Functions As part of Analytics Center of Excellence (COE), the Data Analyst and Data Scientist roles are important to CRA's project teams. You will work closely with internal business consultants and/or clients to solve interesting analytical problems for our clients in areas including commercial strategy, pricing & market access and litigation. In these roles, you will apply your coding and modelling skills, own and personally deliver components of the client engagement, contributing to the overall success of each project. At CRA, we offer a wide range of models/project types, e.g. Patient Journey, Physician Segmentation, Promotional Response Modelling, Forecasting, Web Scraping, etc. As you demonstrate strong analytic and develop sound project management skills, your responsibilities will grow rapidly. Data AnalystCandidates possessing a Masters degree or the equivalent work experience will be considered for the Data Analyst roleData Analysts will generally be key contributors to project teams, focusing on data manipulation, modeling, and delivery of analysis resultsData Analysts who demonstrate strong performance and ability to take on additional responsibility may rapidly ascend to the Data Scientist roleData ScientistCandidates with a Masters degree plus 2 years of relevant work experience OR a PhD may be considered for the Data Scientist roleData Scientists are generally key contributors to both the content and design of analyses, and will often lead project teams and manage key analytics work streamsCandidates with additional relevant experience may be considered for more senior positions, such as Senior Data ScientistResponsibilitiesImport, clean, manipulate and analyse large volume of data (>100MM records) to develop critical insights for our clients' issues, using SAS, SQL or other toolsBuild statistical and machine learning models to detect patterns and investigate important drivers, e.g. regression, Random Forest, Neural Network, clustering, Bayesian, etc., using SAS, R, Python or other specialized tools (e.g. LatentGold, SPSS)Perform text mining and web scraping from online data sources using NLP-relevant packages in PythonApply critical perspective across multiple clients and industry data sources (PharMetrics, Truven MarketScan, XPONENT, etc.)Communicate findings, through visuals, data tables and models, from your analyses to internal team members and, over time, to clientsWork in a demanding but highly collegial and collaborative environmentThis is NOT a technical IT roleQualificationsMaster degree or above, preferably in Statistics, Mathematics, Machine Learning, Computer Science or mathematically-intensive fieldAbility to proficiently process and manipulate data in SQL, SAS, R or PythonExperience in developing advanced models such as multi-variate regression, neural networks, support vector machines, decision trees, clustering and time series using tools such as R and PythonDemonstrate good written and verbal communication skills. Able to present information to various audiencesAbility to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively with people at all levels in an organizationAbility to provide creative solutions to non-standard analytical problemsExperience in data visualization using Power BI, Tableau, D3.js, Qlik Sense, HTML/JavaScript is a plusKnowledge or experience related to pharmaceutical industry and data (e.g. PharMetrics, Truven, Symphony, Optum, Xponent PlanTrak, DDD) is a plusKnowledge of any of the following: Natural Language Processing & Text Mining, Experimental Design, Bayesian Networks, Network/Graph Mining is a plusCandidates with different, specific expertise in broader analytics area (e.g. Data Engineering, Social Listening, Optimization, Simulation) are welcome to apply

Compass is a technology-driven real estate platform that provides comprehensive brokerage services, combining exceptional agents with thoughtfully crafted digital products to make the process of buying, selling, or renting a home intelligent, deliberate, and seamless.  As a Senior Data Analyst of the Data Intelligence Team, you will work with a group of data engineers, data scientists, and analysts in building the Compass data platform. As an expert in data and analytics, you will be responsible for working with product teams to measure the impact, uncover insights, and drive product decisions.  The Data Infrastructure team's mission is to envision, build and deploy the next generation end-to-end platform for data ingestion, processing, storage, scheduling and analysis at massive scale to provide leverage for Compass. Every team at Compass—product, engineering, operations, product experts, people and culture and leadership rely on our platform to make data-informed decisions as well as power the business with data. At Compass You WillPartner with cross-functional stakeholders to define success metrics, develop mechanisms to track the data, and ensure all teams can use data to make decisionsWork closely with data engineers to build a data pipeline that prepares aggregated results for dashboards using SQLExplore our data through user segmentation, cohort analysis, funnels, regression models, etc. to drive a better shared understanding of user behaviorMentor other members of the Data Analyst communityCreate views and models in Looker using LookMLLead the development and maintenance of company-wide dashboards and visualizations that influence product strategyChampion and build a culture of data informed decision makingWhat We Look ForBachelor's degree in an analytical field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics or related field)5+ years experience in a quantitative analysis roleExperience developing, troubleshooting, and optimizing SQL queries, ETL jobs, and data pipelines in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasetsExperience with Business intelligence tools such as Looker or Tableau is a plusBe self-driven, and show the ability to deliver on ambiguous projectsDemonstrated ability to multitask and prioritize diverse tasksStrong communication skills, particularly in relation to data presentation At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone's place.

job1: New York - Junior Data / Business Intelligence Analyst New York
desc: FDM creates and inspires exciting careers that shape our digital future. Through our Careers Program, we recruit and train those aspiring to become IT and business professionals before deploying them on to client sites worldwide. With centers across Europe, North America and APAC, FDM has shown exponential growth throughout the years, firmly establishing itself as an award-winning FTSE 250 employer.  We are currently seeking candidates interested in building a career in Data Analysis / Business Intelligence. Data Analysis and Business Intelligence roles often involve access to business areas in major financial institutions, working on sensitive information and high profile projects, and gaining first-hand exposure to the trade lifecycle. The role is crucial in helping organizations with the accuracy and timely presentation of data, in line with internal process, governance, and regulatory requirements. These opportunities are perfect for those who are team players with strong analytical skills and an aptitude for fast learning.  Prior to working with our clients, your training will take place at one of FDM’s US centers. Successful candidates will receive intense technical and professional training (average 10-16 weeks) through our award-winning FDM Academy. You become an FDM employee from day one and are paid during the training period before placement onsite with our clients in the US. Travel assistance for relocation may be available depending on location and circumstances.  Fast-track career progression is a key focus of FDM, and our program will put you on a pathway that could grow into leadership roles working within multinational organizations. We accept applications on a rolling basis; suitable candidates are encouraged to apply immediately. There is no better way to launch your career than with FDM! Essential Criteria:Bachelor’s degrees (preferably in Finance, Business, Management, or a STEM related field)Excellent communication and interpersonal skillsA desire to work at a large financial firm and ability to increase your financial knowledgeAn analytical approach and problem solving abilitiesProven ability to work under pressure and in fast-paced environmentsExcellent attention to detail and strong organizational and time management abilitiesFlexible for national client placements in the USAble to commit to the two-year consultant program with FDM following completion of trainingLegally authorized to work in the USFDM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, provincial, or local laws.

desc: Strength  Through Diversity  Ground  breaking science. Advancing medicine. Healing made personal.  Dept  Name- Physician Access Services REQ # 2511458  Job  Title: Data Analyst I Roles & Responsibilities: The Data Analyst I for Access Services Department for Mount Sinai  Health System is responsible for implementing best information technology data  management practices in an effort to improve and ensure quality, streamline  data cleaning efforts and deliver analyzable databases within agreed upon  project timelines. Access Services Department consists of but not limited to  the following services: Patient Transfer Center, EMS 911 Ambulance Services,  Physician Access Services, and Discharge Transportation Services.  1.  Analyzes data requests using information technology, claims, clinical,  contract, medical management, and financial, administrative and other corporate  data from both modeled and disparate internal and ixternal sources.  a. Works with  departmental staff to identify requirements for reporting and / or business  intelligence tools.  b. Identifies  necessary data, data sources and methodologies.  c. Collects, organizes,  integrates, analyzes and interprets data.  d. Leverages  advanced statistical analysis methods to create insightful recommendations and  conclusions that may be communicated to the stakeholder.  e. Identifies and  addresses expected and unforeseen data complexities to mitigate their impact on  the analytic outcome and associated business decisions. Develops and  may present reports, analyses and findings to senior management and others as  scheduled or requested.  2. Responsible for one or more of the following  stakeholder groups:  a. Medical  Directors – Helps to identify utilization trends and variations across the  different categories of health care services to assist the Medical Directors to  focus their efforts to maximize contract performance and clinical  effectiveness.  c. Quality and  Documentation – Helps to link payer quality and documentation opportunities  into operational analytic processes to maximize our quality scores, top line  revenue and optimize the use of resources in concert with MS Health System  contracts.  d. Any ongoing  projects.  3.  Takes a proactive role as liaison/analyst for internal stakeholders,  understands their needs and translates them into reporting and analytic  solutions.  4.  Effectively communicates with stakeholders and customers and ensures all  requests are properly triaged, recorded and tracked.  5.  Adheres to corporate standards for performance metrics, data collection, data  integrity, query design, and reporting format to ensure high quality,  meaningful analytic output.  6. Prepares clear, well-organized project-specific documentation, including, at a  minimum, analytic methods used, key decision points and caveats, with sufficient  detail to support comprehension and replication.  8.  Demonstrates entry level proficiency with the principles and methodologies of  process improvement. Applies these in the execution of responsibilities in  support of a process focused approach.  9.  Other duties as assigned Requirements:BS/BA  minimum in related field.Knowledge of  databases, system security and troubleshooting.Understanding  of business practices.Excellent  communication skills.Problem  solving aptitude.Microsoft  Word: Mail merge and know how to embed documentsMicrosoft  Excel: (transferring Word documents to Excel and editing spreadsheets)Previous  experience in a healthcare environment preferred.Strength Through Diversity The  Mount Sinai Health System believes that diversity is a driver for excellence. WHO'S IN THE KITCHENBlue Apron’s Analytics and Business Insights team develops critical metrics and actionable insights on our rapidly expanding customer base and the broader meal kit marketplace. This team also powers business decisions around complex supply chain and logistical challenges.WHAT'S ON THE MENUThe Senior Data Analyst will drive efforts to iteratively improve Blue Apron’s growth and retention strategies. This will include efforts to size risk and opportunity, diligently test new strategies, understand and improve attribution and payback models, create tools and dashboards for business partners, and work directly with senior management to implement new strategies.  Candidates will be motivated self-starters who are comfortable navigating large datasets, building and/or interpreting predictive models, partnering with technical teams building digital product, and understanding customer demand signals. They will be intimately familiar with survey and A/B testing methodology and interpretation. They will be comfortable presenting findings through both verbal and written formats. Candidates will feel confident in their abilities to influence decision making at the highest levels, understand requirements in working with cross functional teams, and be confident in presenting to individuals of all levels throughout the company.  Key responsibilities include: A/B testing strategiesSupport company executives in understanding, forecasting, and managing demand in an emerging industryImproving Blue Apron’s testing environment while supporting an aggressive marketing roadmapIdentify, prioritize, structure, and analyze ad hoc analyses about the business’s demand, customers, marketing efficacy, and business operations to answer questions and integrate insights into the forecasting processNECESSARY INGREDIENTSStrong analytical, organizational, decision making, and presentation skills with experience communicating on an executive levelA deep understanding of A/B testing methodologies, and forecastingInterest and experience in communicating advanced analytics concepts to non-technical executives3+ years of hands-on experience working with very large datasets, including statistical analyses, data visualization, data mining, and data cleansing/transformationExperience with predictive modeling and demand forecasting, demonstrating knowledge of multiple statistical methodologies as well as an understanding of financial and operational impacts of the forecastCoding skills, including:Advanced data manipulation skills in SQLAnalytics tools experience (such as Pandas, R, SQL) a plusExperience performing analysis with large datasetsData visualization (such as Tableau, Looker)Demonstrated ability to multitask and prioritize diverse tasks with a proven ability to meet hard deadlinesAbility to thrive in an unstructured, fast-moving, and constantly evolving environment

NYU School of Medicine is one of the nation’s top-ranked medical schools. For 175 years, NYU School of Medicine has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history and enrich the lives of countless people. An integral part of NYU Langone Health, the School of Medicine at its core is committed to improving the human condition through medical education, scientific research, and direct patient care. For more information, go to med.nyu.edu, and interact with us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Position Summary: We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Sr Data Analyst  In this role, the successful candidate The successful applicant will join DataCore, an innovative team within NYU Langone Health’s Medical Center Information Technology department that utilizes state-of-the-art technology and informatics products to meet the clinical research and analytics needs of a prestigious institution. S/he will primarily support the Center for Healthcare Innovation and Delivery Science (CHIDS). CHIDS is a locus for collaboration among clinicians, researchers, educators, and administrators, who are working together in accelerating the transformation to a learning healthcare system and to improve patient outcomes. S/he will collaborate closely with faculty, clinicians, fellow data analysts, and biostatisticians to advance research and practice in healthcare implementation science, quality of care, and patient safety. In particular, s/he will perform a key role in organizing databases, creating and aggregating datasets, and contributing to analyses for studies in the areas of outcomes-related research, chronic disease management, standard care pathways evaluation, and patient care quality and safety. S/he will also be a key contributor to a federally-funded grant to create a Patient Imaging Quality and Safety Laboratory. Applicants are required to have strong programming and data management skills, including but not limited to proficiency in SAS, R, and SQL and experience in retrieving and analyzing data from clinical and claims databases. Job Responsibilities:Optimize utilization of patient-generated data for research and care; develop rapid-cycle analytic processes with associated feedback to drive improvements in quality, efficiency, and financial performance.Extract, analyze, and present insights from clinical, administrative, and operational data; manage and improve existing databases; develop programs, methodologies, and source files for data analysis and presentation.Provide clinical data for research projects and operational improvement initiatives; perform data analysis in support of ad-hoc requests; collaborate with researchers and administrators in refining query parameters of clinical data extraction/analytical support requests.Combine disparate data sources into an integrated database or dataset.Develop data extraction programs/routines for data transfer to authorized agencies or individuals.Support DataCore clinical research projects in programming tables, listings, and figures (TLFs) using SAS (e.g. for DSMC, QA/QC, etc.).Minimum Qualifications: To qualify you must have a Typically requires 4 or more years of experience and BA/BS degree or equivalent. Preferred Qualifications: SAS Certification preferred, Experience with Population Health information and Clinical Trials Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization. NYU School of Medicine provides its staff with far more than just a place to work. Rather, we are an institution you can be proud of, an institution where you’ll feel good about devoting your time and your talents.  NYU School of Medicine is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender dysphoria, national origin, age, religion, disability, military and veteran status, marital or parental status, citizenship status, genetic information or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision. Please click here to view the Federal “EEO is the law” poster or visit https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm for more information. Location:Secaucus, New JerseyJob Summary:The Data Scientist will be will be responsible for supporting the company’s efforts to create a strong and advanced analytics team focusing on our customer. This position will conduct data mining and develop machine learning algorithms, predictive models and leverage it for customer insights across all channels.  A successful candidate will assist with the development and implementation of marketing analytics and database marketing principles. The successful candidate has a proven track record in customer analytics, predictive modeling and database marketing capabilities. This role will require the ability not only to set and deliver against the overarching strategy, but also to be an active contributor to the daily workload and tactical activities. Customer analytics supports all areas of the customer marketing organization. This is an outstanding opportunity for a motivated, strategic thinker with practical hands-on ability to build upon a talented foundation and to take the customer analytics capability to new heights at The Children’s Place. Responsible for analytical support and statistical modeling for the purpose of maximizing revenue. Ensure valuable model insights are evaluated for long-term reporting utilization.Performs duties by collecting data, analysis, and makes recommendations to management relevant to the strategic direction of marketing programs. Analyzes market conditions, sales trends, customer preferences and competitive behavior.Participate as a thought leader or lead large strategic projects from scope definition through to execution and implementation.Expert level programming skills using SAS, R or Python as a programming language to meet the challenges of advanced data manipulation, complicated programming logic, and large data volumes is required.Minimum three years or equivalent experience of SAS programming using SAS/BASE, SAS/MACRO, SAS/SQL, SAS/STAT, and SAS/GRAPH, SAS Stored Processes in a data intense environment.Experience with SAS Enterprise Guide, SAS Marketing Automation, SAS Data Integration Studio, Enterprise Miner, SAS Web Report Studio, SAS OLAP and SAS Information Map Studio is highly preferred. MS office products and SQL is requiredAssist director and manager of analytics and marketing in promoting and developing a strong sense of analytics culture based on data facts, teamwork, contributionEducation and Experience:Master’s degree in mathematics, statistics, or related field3-5 years in analytics role including experience in advanced analytics (statistical modeling)Experience working with transaction level, email, and customer data strongly preferredRetail industry experience preferredSkills and Behaviors:Ability to manage internal and external resourcesStrong working knowledge in one or more analytics tools such as SAS, R, PythonStrong working knowledge in AdobeSolid understanding of page tagging conceptsProficient in Google Analytics (Preferred)Strong understanding of marketing, user experience, and customer segmentation principles, best practices and analytical approachesAbility to apply digital marketing analytics results to the practical considerations of day-to-day marketing and operational business challengesUnderstanding of machine learning techniques such as Regression, ANOVA, Clustering, Decision Trees, Random Forests, Gradient Boosting MachinesStrong knowledge in online and offline experiments, including A/B testing and multivariate experimentsFamiliar with recommendation systems and algorithmsAbility to analyze, interpret, and develop insights from complex data structureAbility to tell the story focuses on insights, not just data

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.As the only global provider of commercial solutions, IQVIA understands what it takes to deliver nationally and internationally. Our teams help biopharma get their medicines to the people who need them. We help customers gain insight and access to their markets and ultimately demonstrate their product's value to payers, physicians and patients. A significant part of our business is acting as the biopharma's sales force to physicians or providing nurses to educate patients or prescribers. Job Summary: The overall purpose of this position is to act as a Data Analyst responsible for inspecting, cleaning, transforming, and modeling data with the goal of highlighting useful information, suggesting conclusions,and supporting decision making.  The incumbent in this position is primarily responsible for monitoring and preserving data integrity in support of IEEE goals and aspirations so that IEEE can operate efficiently and provide quality service. Also, should be able to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, such as, finding and correcting errors performing root cause analysis, leading projects, as well as utilize critical thinking skills to constantly improve processes.  Accurate metadata maintenance plays a major role in the following areas: Elimination of data related errors.Reduction in volume of inquiries, replacement orders, and follow up correspondence.More accurate label selection, therefore improving publication delivery.Improvement of the accuracy and completeness of metadata for directory products.Integrity of financial transaction integration and related reporting.Supports effective collaboration and communication. The role typically reports to a Manager and manages 0 direct reports. This position works under the Manager of Data Management. Key Responsibilities: Specific duties include but are not limited to: Establish new, and modify existing policies, procedures and controls for the general metadata database, as requires. General metadata includes: Customer & Member records, financial transactions, and Lists of Values (LOVs), and Service Providing Organizations (SPOs)Collaborate with Data Stewards & Data Analysts who have identified data quality issues and help design, create & implement Data Quality Reports to address and/or monitor these issues and/or suggest system enhancements.Work independently on error/exceptions lists, cleaning up meta-data as required and performing analysis of root cause.Support Enterprise Releases and projects for system enhancements, upgrades and user acceptance testing (UAT) by: executing and coordinating tests with Business User and IT QA, as needed; ensuring Test Plans are kept up to date; and communicating processing/system changes to user groups.Effectively identify and analyze system/processing errors and drive solutions to resolve problems.Work closely with business users and Data Quality Associates to understand data relationships and uses, understand root cause of data issues, share assessments, implement solutions and measure results.Drive both proactive and reactive recommendations for data quality improvements and system enhancements by understanding and performing detailed analysis on findings/results from DQ reports.Participate in annual renewal process as needed to ensure data correctness.Lead/Participate in cross-functional, interdepartmental teams and special projects related to data integrity, billing and system processing in support of IEEE initiatives.Ensure company policies and procedures are followed, controls are in place, deadlines are met, and data is accurate.Ensure that data quality procedures, strategies, rules and workflows are documented and kept up to date.Provide guidance and direction to processing groups (Member Operations, Contact Center, Online Support & Reprints) for schedule, handoffs & resolution of issues.Education and Experience: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent relevant to core functions, such as data quality, analytics, management, auditing, accounting, or business administration preferred.  2-4 Years of data quality related experience. IEEE experience and working knowledge of IEEE, including an understanding of IEEE Products & Services as well as IEEE By-Laws a plus. Skills & Other Requirements:Data Quality Management skills are preferredOrganizational, project management, and analytical skills required to prioritize workload, manage multiple tasks, and manage data quality.Excellent leadership, interpersonal, customer service and communication skills required.The ability to communicate complex information effectively to technical and non-technical users.The ability to handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines, along with the ability to work independently, are required.Good business acumen necessary.Technologically savvy worker who seeks out technology solutions to business challenges.Tableau 10 experience required.Marketo or Alterex experience a plus.Proficiency in all aspects of the Microsoft Office Suite, especially Word Documents, Excel, and Power Point.Strong e-mail communication skills and etiquette needed to communicate with other departments.Knowledge of Siebel, Oracle & Google applications would be a plusFor  information on work demands and conditions required for this position, please  consult the reference document, “Physical, Mental,and Work Environment  Standards for IEEE Positions.”This  position is classified underCategory I—Office Position.IEEE  is an EEO/AAP Employer/Protected Veteran/Disabled=============================================================================Disclaimer: This job description outlines the general nature and key features  performed by various positions that share the same job classification. Nothing in this job description restricts  management’s right to assign or re-assign duties to this job at any time due to  reasonable accommodations or other business reasons.

Our Engineering team is at the forefront of this challenge, solving complex technical problems that center around habits, behavior, and lifestyle. Position Overview  If you are tech and data savvy and enjoy working on process improvement and automation projects, this is for you! Legg Mason continues to modernize its technical framework from a tech and business perspective and is in pursuit of a highly motivated Data Governance Analyst to join our small, growing team.  The Data Governance Analyst delivers three essential services to Legg Mason:  Data Governance: Coordinating data governance across various business and technology departments, serving as the primary owner and user of the data governance tool infrastructure to include meta-data management, business glossary, data catalog and data lineage tools. Data Quality: Ensuring fit for purpose data quality capabilities are identified and implemented across all data domains, including defining and drafting business rules for critical data elements and reporting and actioning results of data quality checks. Process improvement and Automation: Providing workflow automation support for business partners, including creating and supporting automation workflows using tools like Alteryx and Xceptor.  Candidates must work and communicate effectively with business users and serve as a power user of data and analytics technology tools. This is a quickly evolving space at Legg Mason and across the asset management industry, so flexibility is critical. Key Responsibilities:Drive Data Governance standards across all data domains via 'use case' delivery and special projects, ensuring business data needs are met on a timely basisSupport and maintain the implementation of data policies & standards, business rules, data definitions, testing depth & data quality controlsManage process within our data governance and metadata inventory tools throughout data lifecycle. Data onboarding & data change management workflowsMaintenance of business terms and definitions, technical metadata, data linage & business transformation rules. Ensure metadata is clear & concise and certified by the Business and Technical StewardsPerform data quality analysis and develop automated business solutions to make sure all the data meet six-dimension data quality rules including Timeliness, Completeness, Uniqueness, Validity, Consistency & Accuracy across all internal core data sources, external facing public websites and 3rd party product databasesWork directly with Business Data Stewards to develop less complex business rules and data quality controls, that can be deployed via Alteryx or other toolsWork directly with Technical Stewards to develop requirements for complex data quality controls that are then implemented via the LM Technology teamPartner with Data Management Group and Data Stewards to ensure implementation of data quality controls. Support & guide development and management of data quality dashboards, scorecards, metrics and reports as required for assigned domains/stewardsProactively develop workflow automation using tools such as Alteryx and/or Xceptor. Manage and administer existing production workflowsProvide training for Data Stewards and Business users on the development, deployment and usage of workflow automation toolsWork across business departments to identify automation opportunities, establish project scope, estimates and target completion datesManage sprint development/demand backlog via JIRA, and provide status updates on all active projectsParticipate in efforts to drive adoption of data governance process and usage of data governance and data automation toolsSupport additional projects as required, working with management & technology to implement process enhancement linked to key Data Governance initiativesQualifications:Bachelor's Degree1-5 years' experience in a similar data or tech role; recent grads with related data/tech coursework or internship experience will also be consideredExperience working within the Financial Services industry a strong plusExperience working with large amounts of data and data analytics tools, specifically in data management and/or data operations functionsExperience in process monitoring, data quality management, master data, business & technical metadata, data profiling, codesets data management a plusExperience developing and writing data policies, standards, and procedures preferred but not requiredFamiliar with data governance concepts, roles and responsibilities (Data Stewards & Domain Owners), business glossaries, data catalogs, data lineage & data qualityFamiliarity working with workflow automation tools, such as Xceptor and Alteryx, and specifically workflow development preferredExperience in Python programming, including data analytics (Pandas), APIs (JIRA REST API, Tableau Server REST API) a strong plus. Knowledge or Python required.Experience or exposure in Tableau dashboard development techniques preferredExcellent communication skills. Ability to work efficiently & effectively in a time critical environment, meeting day to day business deliverables as well as assisting the team in project deliverables. Company Overview  As a leading global asset management firm, Legg Mason offers rewarding career opportunities for individuals who share our passion for investing, and our commitment to putting clients first in everything we do. Whether you have industry experience and are seeking new challenges or are just beginning your career, we invite you to explore the many advantages of joining our global team.  With a presence in every major financial center across the globe, we are always looking for exceptional professionals who want to shape a rewarding career through intellectual curiosity, leadership and collaboration. If you're looking to grow your future with one of the industry's premier firms, consider the many opportunities at Legg Mason today. BenefitsCompetitive pay and benefits, including medical insurance, 401(k) with Company match, profit sharing, ESPP match, and more (learn more)A culture where continuous improvement, innovation, and growth are top of mind, and diversity & inclusion is paramountWork-life balance and flexibilityExtensive paid time off and parental leave (12 weeks' paid parental leave for all regular employees)A learning culture that promotes and supports learning and development; employees are allotted $8,000 per year in reimbursement for continuing education, learning, and development.Company-provided Care.com membershipDiscounts to area fitness centers, large retail chains, cell phone providers and moreDress for your Day dress code (jeans and sneakers!)SDL2017

job1: Senior Data Operations Analyst, Data Analytics
desc: OverviewThe Orchard is a leading music distribution company operating in over 40 markets worldwide – distributing music from independent artists including Ozuna, Skepta, Jorja Smith, John Prine, and Kelsea Ballerini. With cutting edge operations and an unparalleled global team, The Orchard partners with labels of all sizes to make their music and video available across hundreds of digital and physical retailers around the world. At The Orchard, the focus is to provide a comfortable, social and engaging environment to encourage productivity and creativity.  The Orchard is hiring a Senior Data Operations Analyst, Advanced Analytics to join our New York team.ResponsibilitiesReporting to the Associate Director, Analytics Strategy based in New York, NY, The Orchard has an immediate opening for a full-time Senior Data Analyst, working on Advanced Analytics. The NYC-based position will contribute to and help organize the technical systems that support the availability of data and analytics solutions built and maintained for all business verticals at The Orchard. This person will be responsible for understanding business requirements as communicated by internal stakeholders, translating them into technical solutions, and executing on the work required to accomplish those solutions. Success in this position requires a strong ability to communicate and collaborate within the team and with internal stakeholders across The Orchard.QualificationsBachelor’s degree required in Music, Business, Statistics, Technology, or related field2-4 years prior experience working as an Analyst, or in a similar technical roleAbility to gather business requirements mapping those to advanced analytics projects, products and solutionsPrior experience facilitating technical solutions to business problemsIntermediate level of SQL (demonstrate aggregation, join, union, subquery)Strong understanding of database design and query optimization (entity-relationships, database exploration, normalization, keys, indexes)Prior experience working with Looker, or similar BI Tools (Tableau, Mode, Alteryx)Familiarity with Javascript, JSON, React, D3 and other front end data visualization packagesStrong passion for and deep knowledge of music The ideal candidate has: Experience with PL/SQL, or equivalent (demonstrate procedures, functions, triggers)Prior experience working with tools that support technical collaboration (GitHub)Introductory or intermediate experience with Liquid, or similar templating languagesPrior experience working with music or entertainment metadataSome experience working with statistical computer languages (Python, SQL, R, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data setsSome knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications of theseStrong communication skillsTeam player, capable of working effectively within an analytics team, across various engineering teams, and with business stakeholders enterprise-wideAbout The Orchard®  The Orchard is a leading music distribution company operating in over 40 markets worldwide. With a comprehensive artist & label services offering including full-service marketing, sync licensing, comprehensive video services, transparent data analysis, advertising, rights management, digital and physical distribution and more, The Orchard empowers creators and businesses to grow and adapt in the dynamic global industry. For further information, visit www.theorchard.com.  The Orchard is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of age, disability, national origin, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

BBH is seeking a Data Governance Technical Analyst to join our Enterprise Data Governance Team to assist in the implementation and ongoing operation of BBH”s Enterprise Data Governance Program. BBH is building a large data platform and the Data Governance team is assisting with the sourcing activities using a metadata repository, data profiling and quality engine, setting up lineage and business glossary. The analyst will work with other team members and data stewards to continuously improve the data and functionality of the Information Data Fabric platform.  The candidate will be knowledgeable in pillars of Data Governance. Understanding concepts of data warehousing, big data and data lakes. Have skills with reporting tools, visualizations and strong SQL skills for reporting and data analysis. Excellent communication skills, the candidate will communicate with senior business and systems leaders to facilitate the data experience of the platform. Report development be able to build out data quality reports (Cognos or Qlik). Automate the repeatable technology processes. Help to troubleshoot the data, and other technical issues of the platform. Be a self-starter, collaborator, with a positive attitude and willing to learn.
