Who We Are At Cross River, we’re building the best banking and technology products for fintechs, all through APIs. As venture-backed pioneers of the platform-based financial services model known as the sponsor, or partner, bank, we work closely with our partners to offer products such as payments rails and loan origination services to the latest in regulatory and compliance solutions. What drives us every day? A desire to innovate in the service of financial inclusion. Giving access to consumers, whether they are looking for credit or for a better way to pay has been in our DNA from day one. Our nimble, adaptive, one-step ahead culture is powered by our people, and as a result of their creativity, tech-forward thinking and collaborative spirit, we are experiencing explosive growth. What we’re looking for Cross River’s Data Science team is made up of problem solvers hungry to perfect new products and systems. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role. At Cross River, our Data team has an open and transparent environment around process, architecture and development, and everyone’s work is impactful. This position will support critical day to day operations of the SRS program. The position will be responsible for key overall program tracking and data management for SRS reporting. This role will have the opportunity to use data to analyze SRS performance, analyze results, identify opportunity areas, support sales strategies, and help prepare thoughtful read-outs to leadership. This role will be key in providing important reporting and analysis that is necessary for overall program maintenance and to support operational efficiencies through our global Contact Centers. This role will also help provide additional support for marketing of the SRS program. job1: Senior Data Analyst, Environmental Medicine and Public Health
desc: Strength Through Diversity  Ground breaking science. Advancing medicine. Healing made personal.  As part of the World Trade Center Health Program, the General Responder Data Center (DC) is charged with the oversight and coordination of the data management activities of five clinical centers of excellence (CCEs), which provide examinations and clinical assessments of the WTC Responders. The data gathered by the CCEs are centrally managed by the GRDC which is responsible for quality assurance, monitoring and coordination of the data collection, and analyses of the data. The DC also plays an integral role in analyzing these data. The Senior Data Analyst oversees activities related to data integrity, security and enhancement of the value of the data including data cleaning and manipulation, query tracking, and implementing policies and procedures. The Senior Data Analyst may direct the movement of data across multiple systems, oversee data validation and organization, and make certain that the data are available to appropriate people and systems. Roles & Responsibilities:Analyzes, summarizes, and visualizes data from a variety of sources in epidemiological surveillance and routine reporting efforts; assist faculty and staff with queries, statistical analyses, reports and technical difficulties related to data retrieval and usageImplements best practices in data management to ensure the integrity and quality of data and processes; deliver analyzable or analyzed data to internal and external researchers/clients of the Medical CenterTranslates, merges, cleans, and maps data into conceptual, logical and physical data models; document, maintain, and recommend methods to improve data processing, distribution, and flow proceduresUses modeling techniques and tools in analyzing and specifying data structure in large and/or complex data setsRecommends best practices for data transformations to support the data movement. Requisition Number 19-0063 Post Date 9/30/2019 Title Data Analyst, Decision Support City Jericho State NY Description **Position Ineligible for VISA Sponsorship**  SHIFT: Full Time, Monday - Friday, 8:30 am - 5:00 pm (some overtime may be necessary as needed)  The Data Analyst collects, tracks, analyzes and disseminates information that provides support to a variety of stakeholders i.e. corporate, sales representatives etc. This position is a resource charged with establishing and maintaining a company's data policy  and will be a resource for the Purolator International Decision Support Group especially with reporting.  The role of the Analyst has become increasingly important as Purolator International accumulates rapidly growing collections of sensitive enterprise data, information that must be used across all sectors of the corporate environment. The incumbent will interact  with managers and employees across all segments of the company’s operations. This is essential to determine the sometimes conflicting needs of various departments and to develop a data management strategy that works for everyone.  Experience Required In Order To Be Considered: Salesforce.com- extensive knowledge and experienceExcellent Excel skills (Pivot tables, VLookups, Date functions, etc)SQL required – beyond querries, ability to connect reporting to and out of SQL databases and create automated processesPowerPoint- slides creativity as opposed to just pasting results into a deckSome experience of financial analysisPreferred Experience (Not Required):Salesforce.com CertifiedSales performance analyticsVBA coding& automating tasks (not the VBA editor function which records the macros by itself)Other software knowledge that is a plus: Access, Tableau, Alteryx, Sales Force What are we looking for? Detail-oriented, self-motivated, tolerant of stress, dependable and analytical. The ability to think critically and solve multifaceted problems.Use reasoning skills to solve these problems within organizational time and cost constraints. Able to prioritize workloadExcellent communication skills (written & verbal) and demonstrated ability to work with all levels of an organizationThe ability to work well with others, objectively, creatively, diplomatically, with excellent communication skillsWork well with network administrators/technicians in determining their security measures and policiesStrong team orientation, with a proven record of building team relationships with staff, clients and other stakeholdersStrong personal motivation and enthusiasm, interest in and commitment to making a difference in the organizationExcellent technical writing skillsHighly organized and detail orientedOps Finance: • Focus on determining Purolator International’s organizational data warehouse content, defining common definitions, assuring data quality and managing appropriate access especially with customer reporting.  • Responsible for ensuring data consistency and integrity as part of reporting responsibilities  • Identify the needs of the business and its users, as well as determining the extent of database access.  • Performs a variety of ratings analysis using built models. Makes logical decisions on how to present findings that would best suit sales representatives and sales managers; gains a solid understanding of sales reps. requests in order to provide accurate and  useful information.  • Performs shipping profile analysis and provide accurate measurements of client/potential client volumes per lane, per weight bracket, product mix etc.  • Meets established service levels as identified by the Manager, Corporate Finance and Operations.  • Performs weekly, monthly and ad-hoc financial analysis related to volumes, various types of revenues; run reports using existing systems (Beacon, SQL Toad) and consolidate or disseminate reports depending on requirements.  • Supports internal corporate requests i.e. client profitability analysis, variances for branches; collect and consolidate the information required to support branch and/or corporate decision-making.  • Assists with the yearly budget planning process by uploading templates and verifying data accuracy to avoid potential errors in the planning process.  • Contributes to the innovation and customization of current financial models. Collaborates with the districts to find methods by which to improve team reports and better understand reporting requirements. Decision Support: • Follows logical steps when analyzing any data set and identify missing data points that are critical to providing accurate information.  • Works with a large variety of stakeholders i.e. sales teams, corporate clients; maintain good communication and work relationships as data needs to be collected from these stakeholders in order to provide accurate reporting  • Compiles shipping profiles with respect to contracts, line haul examinations and CARR reviews.  • Supports the automation of tasks using VBA or SQL. Sales Support: • Influence the design of reports and processes. Testing for optimal performance will be a key functional responsibility. In some case, integrating old systems or databases with the current application may be required.  • Deliver reports requested by the sales organization on time. Ensure that the daily goals of responsiveness and accuracy are met. Requirements Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Requirements: • Detail-oriented, self-motivated, tolerant of stress, able to work in fast paced environment, dependable and analytical. The ability to think critically and solve multifaceted problems.  • Use reasoning skills to solve these problems within organizational time and cost constraints. Able to prioritize workload  • Excellent communication skills (written & verbal) and demonstrated ability to work with all levels of an organization  • The ability to work well with others, objectively, creatively, diplomatically, with excellent communication skills  • Strong team orientation, with a proven record of building team relationships with staff, clients and other stakeholders  • Strong personal motivation and enthusiasm, interest in and commitment to making a difference in the organization  • Excellent technical writing skills  • Highly organized and detail oriented  • Make decisions independently with limited supervision or guidance  Education and/ or Work Experience Requirements Bachelor’s degree or college diploma in finance, economics, accounting, or related field with an inclination towards quantitative studies (math or statistics)3+ years’ on-the-job related experienceProficient in MS ExcelHighly proficient in SQLHighly proficient in SalesForce.comPython, VBA, Alteryx, Tableau are a plus*Position Ineligible for VISA Sponsorship**Working Conditions: • Repetitive movements (i.e. typing, data entry, assembly).  • Constant sitting or standing in one position.  • Concentrated visual or auditory attention. Job Benefits Purolator International, Inc. provides a competitive benefits package to employees and their families, including:  • Medical, Dental, Vision, Prescription Drugs (80%+ paid by Employer)  • 401k with up to 6% Employer Company Match  • Employer Funded Life Insurance  • Annual Bonus Incentive Plan  • Disability/Income Protection  • Tuition Assistance  • Employer Funded Health Savings Account (H.S.A)  • Paid Time Off (Total of 29 days)  Purolator International, Inc. is proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V.  We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing and background verification checks. The incumbent will design, develop and manage these resources in a data warehousing environment, utilizing a thorough understanding of available technology, tools and best practices. job1: Senior Data Analyst, Supervised Release Program
desc: The Center for Court Innovation is a non-profit organization that works to create a more effective and humane justice system by performing original research and helping launch reforms around the world. The Center creates operating projects that have been documented to reduce the use of jail and prison, assist victims of crime, and strengthen communities. Nationally and internationally, the Center performs original research and provides consulting services to justice innovator.  The Center's Data Analytics and Applied Research (DAAR) team is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to work primarily on the Supervised Release Program (SRP), a pretrial alternative to bail and detention in New York City. This position offers an opportunity to develop and implement data processes and protocols that ensure criminal justice researchers, stakeholders and policymakers are equipped with the valid and reliable data needed to identify trends, measure outcomes, and inform policy.  The Senior Data Analyst will provide critical data support to this innovative, cross-borough initiative by conducting regular data quality audits, coordinating database management tasks, developing comprehensive data documentation and training materials, and collaborating with researchers to generate analyses, reports, visualizations, and interactive dashboards that help monitor and evaluate program indicators and outcomes. The Senior Data Analyst reports directly to the Deputy Director of Data Analytics and Applied Research and is responsible for directly supervising one Data Analyst.  The successful candidate must bring a real interest in this work along with extensive knowledge of relational databases, data visualization software (Tableau), and a demonstrated ability to write complex queries in SQL (or other programming languages used to extract and manipulate data). For more information about the Center's operating programs, please visit www.courtinnovation.org/programs. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:Conduct regular data audits by generating automated reports that effectively and efficiently flag data discrepancies that need to be addressed in the Center's case management database;Analyze data for common trends in data quality and systematize findings to identify and prioritize specific areas for improvement;Coordinate and manage modifications to the database to ensure standardization across multiple SRP sites;Develop and implement protocols for tracking changes made to the database and/or data collection and reporting processes;Support the management of the organization-wide database more generally (e.g., gather, analyze, and determine data and information needs across multiple initiatives and propose solutions to streamline data collection and reporting practices)Develop and maintain data codebooks and database documentation;Provide technical support to the DAAR team:Build and maintain interactive dashboards and produce data visualizations using Tableau;Prepare analytical datasets by querying, extracting, merging, cleaning, and re-coding programmatic data from the Center's case management database;Perform quality assurance checks on queries and data reports;Contribute to/assist with data analyses for special research projects;Identify and facilitate data-related training and development opportunities for the DAAR teamCollaborate with the Center's Technology team to improve DAAR-Tech processes and act as liaison to Lead Solutions Architect;Provide direct supervision for, and manage professional development of, one Data Analyst.Qualifications: The ideal candidate will have a Master's Degree or a Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative discipline, plus 3-5 years' of relevant data experience, preferably in the criminal justice field. Qualified applicants must be inherent problem solvers with exceptional attention to detail, strong logical reasoning, analytical, and communication (written and oral) skills. Other qualifications include: Working knowledge of RDBMS concepts (relational databases), experience with database interface and query software, such as Toad or Oracle SQL Developer, and a demonstrated ability to write complex, highly-optimized SQL queries (or equivalency) to extract and manipulate data are required;ââââFamiliarity with Salesforce platforms is preferred;Statistical software syntax expertise is required (R, Python, SPSS, SAS, Stata et);Professional experience using data visualization software and/or mapping tools such as ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS or equivalency in a professional setting is required (Tableau skills strongly preferred);Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, filters, basic formulas) is required; Access, PowerPoint (or Prezi) skills also preferred;Infographics expertise is required;Experience manipulating and analyzing large datasets is required; familiarity with administrative and government datasets is a plus;Knowledge of basic statistical analysis methods such as regression and ANOVA is a plus;Strong task management skills and a demonstrated ability to meet deliverables in a timely manner are required;Demonstrated ability to work independently and take initiative to solve problems as they arise is a must; Applicants must also be comfortable collaborating with teammates as well as colleagues from various other departments, including technology and operations;Prior management or supervisory experience is a plus;Knowledge of and strong interest in the criminal justice system is a must.Location: Midtown, NY with occasional travel to one or more of the Center's three project sites operating the Supervised Release Program in three boroughs: Staten Island Community Justice Center, Brooklyn Justice Initiatives, and Bronx Community Solutions. Compensation: Salary range starts at $70,000 and is commensurate with experience. Excellent benefits package including comprehensive health, dental and life insurance, four weeks paid vacation, paid sick time, TransitChek, Flexible Spending Account plans for health and dependent care, a 403(b) retirement plan and a 401(k) retirement plan with a generous employer match.  The Fund for the City of New York/Center for Court Innovation is an equal opportunity employer. The Center does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other category protected by law. We strongly encourage and seek applications from women, people of color, members of the lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender communities as well as individuals with prior contact with the criminal justice system.  In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete an employment eligibility verification document form upon hire. Only applicants under consideration will be contacted. No phone calls please.

job1: Data Science Analyst I Computational Biology - Genetics
desc: Strength Through Diversity  Ground breaking science. Advancing medicine. Healing made personal.  The Icahn Institute for Genomics & Multiscale Biology is looking for talented data scientists with the responsibilities and qualifications listed below. At the Icahn Institute, our vision is to transform biomedical research and healthcare delivery into a data-driven, evidence-based, patient-tailored discipline. The Icahn Institute was founded in 2011 to help advance precision medicine with cutting-edge technologies, novel partnerships between the public and private sectors, and world class computational and analytical resources. By maximally leveraging information from patients around the world, we deliver premier precision care optimized for each patient, while discovering breakthrough, next-generation treatments through insights derived from cutting-edge analytics applied to unprecedented amounts of patient-derived data. We promote a core set of values designed to promote our future vision of team-oriented, data driven global biomedical research: 1) Do good for the patient, 2) Simplify, 3) Share openly, 4) Focus, 5) Synergize, 6) Contributions, not politics, and 7) Deliver. Role & Responsibilities: Data Scientists at Mount Sinai work with clinicians, researchers, and engineers to extract value from data. Effective data science is critical to the success of our research efforts and clinical translation, ensuring we make correct inferences from the vast wealth of biomedical data generated at Mount Sinai and across the world.  Data Scientists may work on many of the cutting-edge research areas at Mount Sinai, including: Analysis of high throughput genomic, transcriptomic, epigenetic, proteomic, and other omics data in healthy and disease statesAnalysis of multiscale single cell omics data to perform multitissue cellular de novo taxonomy in healthy and disease statesScalable machine learning approaches to network and predictive models of biological processesMedical record mining using large-scale electronic health record biobanks. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and programming proficiencies and proven expertise in high-dimensional data analysis. Specific duties are listed below. Apply computational techniques to analyze large-scale biomedical datasets.Develop and maintain genetic, genomic, and biological databases to annotate and interpret human genome dataCreate data-driven models and data visualizations for clinical and research workPerform rigorous and reproducible data analysesDevelop projects and work independently on a variety of data analysis projectsLearn and use bioinformatics tools for processing and analysis of large datasetsIdentify and resolve technical issues and propose upgrades to current softwareParticipate in the preparation of manuscripts, grants, and presentationsOther technical and leadership duties as assigned and commensurate with experience and skillsRequirements:Masters, or Ph.D. in Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Computer Science, Biology, Biomedical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Genetics, or other relevant quantitative disciplineGood organization and communication skills, with demonstrated ability to productively work as a member of a team. Strong verbal and written communication skills in English are requiredExperience in data science, machine learning, statistical modeling, genomic analysis, or other relevant analytical fieldExperience in programming environments such as R, Matlab, SAS, Stata, Python/JupyterWorking experience with genetics or statistics analysis software and online resources or other biomedical data analysis is a plusTrack record of delivering complex scientific projects through high impact factor publicationsKnowledge and experience with software engineering best practices such as: version control, code review, unit/regression testing, continuous development/continuous integration Strength Through Diversity  The Mount Sinai Health System believes that diversity and inclusion is a driver for excellence. We share a common devotion to delivering exceptional patient care. Yet we're as diverse as the city we call home- culturally, ethically, in outlook and lifestyle. When you join us, you become a part of Mount Sinai's unrivaled record of achievement, education and advancement as we revolutionize healthcare delivery together.  We work hard to recruit and retain the best people, and to create a welcoming, nurturing work environment where you have the opportunity and support to develop professionally. We share the belief that all employees, regardless of job title or expertise, have an impact on quality patient care.  Explore more about this opportunity and how you can help us write a new chapter in our story!  Who We Are  Over 38,000 employees strong, the mission of the Mount Sinai Health System is to provide compassionate patient care with seamless coordination and to advance medicine through unrivaled education, research, and outreach in the many diverse communities we serve.  Formed in September 2013, The Mount Sinai Health System combines the excellence of the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai with seven premier hospitals, including Mount Sinai Beth Israel, Mount Sinai Brooklyn, The Mount Sinai Hospital, Mount Sinai Queens, Mount Sinai West (formerly Mount Sinai Roosevelt), Mount Sinai St. Luke's, and New York Eye and Ear Infirmary of Mount Sinai.  The Mount Sinai Health System is an equal opportunity employer. We promote recognition and respect for individual and cultural differences, and we work to make our employees feel valued and appreciated, whatever their race, gender, background, or sexual orientation. OverviewFounded in 1908, CIT (NYSE: CIT) is a leading national bank empowering businesses and personal savers with the financial agility to navigate their goals. We believe in helping customers turn their ideas into outcomes. Whether those customers are building a business or building their savings, CIT has the experience and agility to empower them to achieve their goals. At CIT, how we do business is just as important as what we do. Our social responsibility programs focus on driving financial and personal empowerment, supporting the environment and advancing wellness. CIT contributes to communities where we live, work and do business through charitable donations, community investments and employee volunteerism.ResponsibilitiesCIT is looking for a strong candidate to help grow the use of data analytics within the Internal Audit Services (IAS) Department. The role supports all groups within the audit department and includes the use of various analytic techniques and technologies to automate control testing, isolate anomalies of interest, and gain efficiencies within the audit department and with our auditees. The ideal candidate will have a hybrid of audit, data analytics, and database/developer experience. This position will report to the head of the Analytics team.  Principal Duties & Responsibilities:• Work as part of a team to identify, design, develop, and document analytics that will support audit testing, continuous auditing, continuous monitoring, automation, and fraud identification.• Act as a business analyst to develop requirements for reports through interaction with the auditors.• Script analytic routines that can be pushed to business partners to maximize return on investment.• Build productive relationships with internal audit team members, peers, data owners and IT to ensure availability of information and to encourage the development of new analytics.• Support the corporate investigations group with periodic forensic investigations and root cause analyses.Qualifications• Programming experience in one of the following languages: SQL, Python, C# or Perl.• Experience with database development. ETL package development/deployment is highly desirable.• Advanced MS Excel skills including pivot tables, vlookups, index/match, and macros.• Experience with visualization tools, such as Power BI, Qlikview, and/or Tableau, is a plus.• Ability to synthesize meaningful insights from disparate sources of data.• Strong written and verbal communication skills, with experience working as a member of a multi-member team on a variety of cross-department projects.• Maintains a healthy level of auditor skepticism in all situations.  Education & Experience: • Bachelor's (or higher) degree in Accounting, Information Management, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Decision Sciences, Data Sciences or related field.• 2 - 3 years’ experience, preferably in banking.  #LI-JB1

job1: Specialist, Big Data Senior Analyst (Treasury and ALM)
desc: This staff  position is expected to be able, under minimal supervision, provide expertise  to the data gathering, governance and management aspects in procedures/policy writing, liquidity  assessments, analytical research, calculations, modeling and forecasting processes  related to controlling the risks associated with assets, liabilities, liquidity  funding, capital and IRR management. The successful candidate will be expected  to interface with internal and external stakeholders to build and maintain a  broad range of knowledge spanning the range of treasury, capital and asset and  liability categories across the organization and its varied products/services. This  staff member specializes in ALM data related matters that may also impact other  domains such as: Deposit Liabilities, Intraday Liquidity, Interest Rate Risk,  Currency Risk, Capital Management and Planning, and Balance Sheet Modeling through  the use of the ALM owned data set. The staff member may provide support for the  input on data quality issues into development of the ALM policy and strategy in  alignment with Corporate guidance, and regulatory requirements. The staff position takes direction from a  senior member of the team that manages ALM data governance processes and the  production and submission of Corporate Treasury-ALM data quality related  information to the Companys governance committees.  The staff  member will be expected to cultivate relationships with staff or contractors in:  Technology, the Finance Chief Data Office/Data Stewards, Data Strategy, Data  Operations, Risk Management, Finance and Corporate Treasury to ensure efficient  identification, collection, and use of data along with the management of the  associated data governances processes. The staff member may be required to support  interactions with applicable regulators relating to their assigned  responsibilities. As part of the learning expected for the position, this the  staff member will help monitors the regulatory environment, assist in the  conduct of applicable research, and support recommendations for responding to  emerging/changing regulatory requirements effecting ALM data management,  analytics, and reporting.  This staff  position is expected to assist in monitoring less experienced team members,  guiding and coaching them on their work accuracy and quality particularly  around unusual issues. The staff member  will also have to be ready to support projects as directed. This work may include an assignment to conduct  special projects and ad-hoc analyses/reporting as requested. In the course of this work the staff member may  be required to serve as a project representative, engaging peers across the Bank.QualificationsBachelors  degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.  Degree in math, engineering, statistics, computational finance or economics  preferred. Work toward or completion of MBA, CFA, or CPA/CA preferred. Five to  seven years of total work experience preferred.  Experience with balance sheet data, its use, governance and management,  and related data in some of the following: balance sheet and liquidity analytics  and reporting, interest rate risk management, or asset-liability management  within large complex financial organizations is strongly preferred. Knowledge  of the structuring of data environments and applications that use big data  processes is a preferred. Some experience with Business Intelligence data  management and visualization applications specific to Hadoop big data (such as  Presto/Athena) and the ability to use SQL/Hive and other computer languages  used in big data for analysis and structuring is preferred.BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Senior Data Management Analyst  Look for more than answers. Patients and Physicians rely on our diagnostic testing, information and services to help them make better healthcare decisions. These are often serious decisions with far reaching consequences, and require sensitivity, tact and a clear dedication to service. It’s about providing clarity and hope.  You will work for the world leader in the industry, with a career where you can expand your skills and knowledge. You’ll have a role where you can act with professionalism, you can inspire colleagues, and you can care about the work we do and the people we serve.  At Quest, we are on a continuous journey of discovery and development. It’s this attitude that has made us an industry leader and the #1 Diagnostic Lab in the US. For those joining us, we offer exciting and fast moving career opportunities where you can affect change at a rate unheard of in many organizations of our size and scope. While we invest in and develop technology to drive our innovations, our ongoing success relies on our people.  The Senior Data Management Analyst position is responsible for updating  and maintaining the laboratory testing database, and writing SAS programs to collect,  analyze and report insights critical to the Employer Solutions drug testing  business. Primary tools used are SAS, Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft Access. This  role will work closely with various functions in the business including the  analytics, marketing, sales, account management, and finance teams. As the  Employer Solutions business works to ensure greater quality control, data  integrity, consistency and speed in reporting, succession plans for key  resources, and capabilities for the analysis and interpretation of information,  we have identified the need for a dedicated resource to work on a variety of  critical data analysis tasks. The candidate must be able to quickly gain a deep  working knowledge of our systems and data, they must be data and detail-driven,  able to work both independently and under direction, and must also be able to  successfully prioritize their efforts to meet tight deadlines. This position  offers a challenging work environment that will stretch and develop analytical,  research, problem-solving, and communication skills.  Duties and Responsibilities:  Update and maintain laboratory testing database as needs for modifications and additions arise  Write and modify SAS programs to accurately pull and report data and metrics  Grow to understand laboratory and business operations deeply to accurately modify laboratory testing database and create meaningful, actionable reports  Take on and prioritize the execution of new projects. These projects will vary in length, scope, complexity, priority, audience, and input  Demonstrate ability to simultaneously manage multiple projects and to produce required deliverables by the established deadlines and with the appropriate level of detail, accuracy, and quality control  Ability to communicate effectively  Strong, consistent attention to detail is critical  Ability to identify and investigate patterns and irregularities in data  Must be inquisitive, able and willing to ask clarifying questions  Partner with key inputs to ensure that outputs are accurate, appropriate to the audience, and well-delivered  Consistently work to ensure accuracy of the data by conducting monthly verifications and other research as needed  Promote a positive work environment and collaborate with cross-functional team members to support the business  Willingness and ability to learn new things and cross-train while managing several projects and inputs simultaneously Supervision Exercised:N/AQualifications:Education Required: Bachelor’s degree in business, analytics, information technology, information systems, computer programming, or a related field is preferred Work Experience: Work experience or coursework in SAS programming is  preferred, but experience with other programming language(s) and a willingness  to learn SAS will be considered Physical and Mental: Able to sit or stand for long periods Other: Understanding of relational databases; SQL experience is valuable  Demonstrated knowledge in utilizing the Microsoft Office suite of products  Laboratory experience is a plus  Strong willingness to learn and understand our current data to improve the insights we use to better our business  Excellent analytical, time management, and organizational skills. Must be able to prioritize multiple simultaneous projects, while ensuring that deadlines are met  As a member of the data team, the expectation is that the candidate will have strong written and verbal communication skills, the ability to creatively solve complex problems, excellent teamwork and interpersonal skills, and strong attention to detail  A self-directed, self-motivated, detail and deadline-oriented individual will excel in this role.  Occasional travel – up to 10% - may be required at times  All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. Quest Diagnostics is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Women / Minorities / Veterans / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity or Citizenship

Founded in 1967, W. R. Berkley Corporation (WRBC) has grown from a small investment management firm into one of the largest commercial lines property and casualty insurers in the United States.  Along the way, we’ve been listed on the New York Stock Exchange, seen our revenue soar well past $7 billion, and become a well-respected Fortune 500 Company.  Today, the Berkley brand comprises 53 Berkley companies worldwide. Still managed by our founder and largest shareholder, W. R. Berkley Corporation is well-positioned to respond to opportunities for future growth.  In April 2017, W. R. Berkley Corporation celebrated the 50th anniversary of its founding.  Within WRBC, the Enterprise Program Management Office (EPMO) led by the Chief Project Officer (CPO) is responsible for execution and delivery of enterprise-wide program execution, technology enablement, business process automation and financial data analytics to facilitate operational efficiencies. The EPMO function focuses on expediting on-schedule, on-budget project delivery mechanisms across the organization with a focus on measurable business benefits while turning enterprise data into actionable intelligence. ResponsibilitiesThe Senior Data Governance Analyst will report to the Corporate Data Manager within the EPMO function and collaborate with multiple stakeholders across the organization to support the strategic Berkley data pipeline initiative called the Berkley Data Warehouse (BDW) in an effort to maximize the value and integration of our enterprise data assets. Job DescriptionResponsibilities:Build out and maintain data governance processes and data element relationships facilitating the most optimal fit for the business while aligning with the current capabilities of the BDW solution.Collaborate with multiple WRBC business units and IT team members to document and implement Data Governance standards. Instill Data Governance standards and best practices while enabling the data steward model across the organization.Capture and manage metadata to ensure data integrity. Track and manage data quality exception remediation process using the Data Governance Dashboard.Collaborate with multiple WRBC business units and IT team members to validate that data is accurate, complete and appropriate for its intended use. Similarly, work with the above-mentioned stakeholders to ensure source to target mappings.Design, build and deploy Data Governance workflows, templates and other artifacts to facilitate execution of various governance functions. Also, work with WRBC business units to ensure compliance with the enterprise data governance procedures and provide guidance on business process changes in reference to data quality.Maintain the Information Governance Catalog (IGC) and Reference Data Management (RDM) tools that support the data standards for the BDW solution. QualificationsMinimum of 5 years’ experience in data management or similar function(s).Ability to work independently and on several tasks concurrently.Strong verbal and written communication skills. Strong organization skills and attention to detail.Good SQL and VBA skills.Proficient in other Microsoft Office products (Word, PowerPoint, Access).Familiarity with Insurance industry and/or Financial Services industry.Bachelors’ Degree in any of the follow areas: Computer Science, Information Systems, Accounting, Finance, Mathematics, Actuarial Science or similar disciplines.Familiarity with IBM Data Governance tools a plus.​OptionsCreate Profile & ApplyApplyShare

Our core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location. How will this role have an impact? This individual will be an integral part of developing and improving the Analytics team’s Claims Data Engineering systems. This role will require a strong familiarity with analytical techniques, data programming and claims data engineering experience to help the team implement and maintain claims data engineering systems and bundled payment models that support the needs for all Analytics downstream stakeholders; as well as, when needed, conduct detailed analyses of data from our payor and provider partners. These efforts will play a crucial role in helping us to improve healthcare quality, and ultimately enhance the patient experience, and reduce Medicare spending.  This role will report to our Director of Claims Data Engineering. What will you do? Working closely with the Manager of Claims Data Engineering you will: Maintain and improve currently implemented claims data engineering systems and processesImplement new bundled payment programs and update current programs where applicableCommunicate clearly to a non technical audience about changes that have been made in systems and bundled payment program implementationsProduce ad-hoc data engineering solutions for new business needs that may have a quick turnaround time As a Claims Data Engineering Senior Analyst you will make individual contributions supporting multiple projects while continuing to enhance your technical skills and work towards learning project leadership. We are looking for someone with:B.S. or higher in a quantitative, healthcare or economic discipline1-2 years experience in Python (and Pandas) or R preferred (Python is ideal). Strong experience in other Data languages (e.g., SAS or Stata) will be consideredA Basic understanding of SQL is a plusExperience working with very large, diverse DatasetsExperience using multi processing systems is a plus (e.g Spark, or even simply the Python multiprocessing library)Experience using AWS tools such as S3 is a plusAbility to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiencesPrior experience with Value-Based Payments analytics a plusOur benefits include but are not limited to: Paid Time Off 401(k) Savings Plan with match Medical, Vision & Dental Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits Parental Leave Gym Reimbursement Tuition ReimbursementAbout Us Remedy Partners delivers software and services that enable payers, employers and at-risk providers to organize and finance healthcare delivery around a patient's episode of care. For healthcare providers, Remedy Partners’ software, analytics and administrative services support bundled payment contracts with Medicare and Commercial Insurers, often through shared-risk partnerships. For payers, Remedy Partners empowers the development of bundled payment contracting programs and guides development of bundled payment networks. Remedy Partners presently delivers its services to partners at more than 1,000 healthcare locations nationwide.

job1: Data Analyst (Radar Systems) with Security Clearance
desc: Highlights: • In this role as Data Analyst, you will be an integral part of the design, development, integration and test of precision fires radar systems supporting Long Range Armament Munitions and Counter-UAS Weapon Systems. These programs are key to solving urgent needs to protect US military and civilian personnel. • The Combat Capabilities Development Command (CCDC) Armaments Center is a national asset vital to national security and is unfettered in its ability to deliver products and provide world-class facilities and services. You will join a dynamic team of engineers, sensor specialists and industry experts developing the worlds premier weapon systems. The CCDC Armaments Center provides a unique experience in a fast-paced yet business casual environment. • The Data Analyst position supporting the Battlespace Applications Branch of the Tactical Effects, Protection & Interactive Technologies division provides a unique opportunity to support development of leading-edge technologies addressing key issues affecting national security. The opportunity to collaborate with some of the most innovative and talented minds of the military/industrial complex combined with the vast resources of the CCDC Armaments Center is unique indeed. • You will make significant impacts to national defense by applying your analytical skills to implement the next generation technologies used on the battlefield. • You will have the opportunity to hone and expand your skills in data analytics to facilitate development of leading-edge, integrated sensor and weapon systems. Each day will present a new opportunity to learn and grow by strengthening and expanding your abilities in data analytics. You will have opportunity to use the industrys most advanced data analytical tools and develop special-purpose data analytics unique to the Battlespace Applications Branch. Professional development is encouraged and expected. • Day-to-day activities of the Data Analyst include evaluation of system performance specifications, modeling and simulation, data collection, signal processing, test-data analysis, assessment of system performance in all phases of system development. The Data Analyst will participate in design review meetings, interact with hardware and software developers, integrators, test range personnel and the intended user community. The Data Analyst will generate white papers, final reports, and briefing materials to disseminate information to peers and management. Occasionally, you will travel with the development team to military test ranges to conduct site visits or testing and evaluation activities for commercial and/or military systems. Tasks: A Data Analyst is required to provide program support to the U.S. Army Combat Capabilities Development Command Armaments Center (CCDC-AC) Battlespace Applications Branch Precision Radars Team at Picatinny, NJ. The Data Analyst will implement real-time algorithms in a sensor-weapon computational architecture. The Data Analyst will support development, evaluation and test of sensor-enabled weapon systems. This Analyst will: • Exploit data from a variety of sensors and systems collected during test events and laboratory simulations; parse, organize, manipulate and analyze data to generate plots, tables, and draw new, unique conclusions on system performance metrics, goals and objectives • Interface with Battlespace Applications Branch Chief and technical leads; Integrated Product Team Leads (IPT) and customers within CCDC-AC to inform data collection events and data analysis techniques • Generate white papers, final reports, and briefing materials to disseminate analytic assessments and conclusions to peers and management • Support and participate in demonstration and test events at DoD test ranges across the US Required Qualifications: • B.S. in relevant technical discipline and 5 years of relevant data analysis experience • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite of tools, including Word, Excel and PowerPoint • Adept at interfacing with existing architectures and code • Experience/knowledge in understanding and interpreting software interface documentation and integration activities between disparate systems to understand messaging structures and derive system performance • Demonstrated proficiency in MATLAB; desire to contribute to research and development of programs focused on future weapon systems; and demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a multi-disciplinary team • US citizenship • Ability to secure a security clearance • Good communication skills (oral and written) • Ability to work in a team environment  Desired Qualifications: • Electrical, Mechanical, Aerospace, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Physics degree • Proficiency/familiarity in C, C++, or other programming languages and analytical software • Department of Defense Secret clearance  Travel: up to 50% travel depending on the project Shift: Day Shift Desired Qualifications: • Electrical Engineering degree and background with radar systems • Background in Physics, Radio Frequency and Communications systems, and Electronic Warfare helpful • Familiar with US Army platform mounted weapon stations, unmanned air systems, state-of-the-art radar, optic or laser systems • Experience with Ground-based radar systems for applications in Ground Moving Target Indicator (GMTI); Counter-Rockets, Artillery and Mortar (C-RAM); or Counter-Unmanned Aircraft Systems (C-UAS) • Department of Defense Secret clearance Location: Picatinny, New Jersey Clearance: Current DoD Secret Clearance (requires US Citizenship) Apply: Online at https://idealinnovations.com/careers Ideal Innovations, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer:  All qualifiedapplicants will receive consideration for employmentwithout regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status.  Ideal Innovations, Inc. is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

How will this role have an impact? This individual will be an integral part of developing and improving the Analytics team’s Claims Data Engineering systems. This role will require a strong familiarity with analytical techniques, data programming and claims data engineering experience to help the team implement and maintain claims data engineering systems and bundled payment models that support the needs for all Analytics downstream stakeholders; as well as, when needed, conduct detailed analyses of data from our payor and provider partners. These efforts will play a crucial role in helping us to improve healthcare quality, and ultimately enhance the patient experience, and reduce Medicare spending.  This role will report to our Director of Claims Data Engineering. What will you do? Working closely with the Manager of Claims Data Engineering you will: Maintain and improve currently implemented claims data engineering systems and processesImplement new bundled payment programs and update current programs where applicableCommunicate clearly to a non technical audience about changes that have been made in systems and bundled payment program implementationsProduce ad-hoc data engineering solutions for new business needs that may have a quick turnaround time As a Claims Data Engineering Senior Analyst you will make individual contributions supporting multiple projects while continuing to enhance your technical skills and work towards learning project leadership. We are looking for someone with:B.S. or higher in a quantitative, healthcare or economic discipline1-2 years experience in Python (and Pandas) or R preferred (Python is ideal). Strong experience in other Data languages (e.g., SAS or Stata) will be consideredA Basic understanding of SQL is a plusExperience working with very large, diverse DatasetsExperience using multi processing systems is a plus (e.g Spark, or even simply the Python multiprocessing library)Experience using AWS tools such as S3 is a plusAbility to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiencesPrior experience with Value-Based Payments analytics a plusOur benefits include but are not limited to: Paid Time Off 401(k) Savings Plan with match Medical, Vision & Dental Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits Parental Leave Gym Reimbursement Tuition ReimbursementAbout Us Remedy Partners delivers software and services that enable payers, employers and at-risk providers to organize and finance healthcare delivery around a patient's episode of care. For healthcare providers, Remedy Partners’ software, analytics and administrative services support bundled payment contracts with Medicare and Commercial Insurers, often through shared-risk partnerships. For payers, Remedy Partners empowers the development of bundled payment contracting programs and guides development of bundled payment networks. Remedy Partners presently delivers its services to partners at more than 1,000 healthcare locations nationwide.

desc: Cognizant continuously seek outstanding associates when recruiting new employees. We pride ourselves on having extensive experience working with clients in all major markets. Cognizant's delivery model is infused with a distinct culture of high customer happiness. We consistently deliver positive relationships, cost reductions and business results. Do you dream of working with a dynamic learning community that offers the latest knowledge in AI & Analytics Space?  At Cognizant, we believe those who challenge the way they work today will own the way tomorrow. Our diverse backgrounds offer different perspectives and new ways of thinking. It encourages lively discussions, inspires thought leadership, and helps us build better solutions for our clients. We want someone who thrives in this setting and is inspired to craft meaningful solutions through true collaboration.  If you’re comfortable with ambiguity, excited by change, and excel through autonomy, we’d love to hear from you.  Cognizant is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran. If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions in the US please send an email with your request to CareersNorthAmerica@cognizant.comQualification / Experience: • Experience in the Data Integration  • Prior knowledge of SP Data flows & how Specialty pharmacies work  • Prior data management experience, including Data Quality and QC approaches  • Strong project management & vendor management skills  • Clear, concise communication skills, both verbal and written  • Ability to pull data from data lake/warehouse and strong analytic skills  Employee Status : Full Time Employee  Shift : Day Job  Travel : No  Job Posting : Oct 29 2019  About CognizantCognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. job1: Business Analyst - Enterprise Data Management Team (EDM) - CR
desc: Company DescriptionAs one of the original innovators in lending, credit, fraud, and spend analytics, Verisk Financial integrates one of the industry’s largest sets of data to help banks, financial regulators, retailers, and media companies grow their businesses. We combine data with predictive analytics to uncover new consumer and business insights and integrate this data with the most technologically advanced platforms.  Verisk Financial | Argus is a leading provider of intelligence, decision support solutions, and advisory services to financial institutions across the global commerce ecosystem. Our clients include more than 50 top U.S., Canadian, and other international financial organizations, regulators, payment providers, merchants, and media. Argus is the leading source of segment-level portfolio management benchmarking data, analytics, models, and advisory services. We maximize value delivery to clients by combining proprietary data sets, cutting-edge software and analytic tools, domain expertise, and our unique results-oriented approach. Customers worldwide use our services for tailored data management solutions that include business intelligence platforms, profile views, mobile data solutions, enterprise database services, and fraud risk scoring algorithms for marketing, fraud, and risk mitigation. Our clients gain competitive advantage from our exclusive focus on leveraging global best-in-class analytics and methodologies to help achieve their business and regulatory objectives. To learn more about Argus please visit us at: www.argusinformation.com. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!  With a history of impressive growth, an innovative culture, and offering industry-leading solutions, Verisk Analytics is an amazing place to work and make a difference. In 2018, Forbes magazine named Verisk to its World’s Best Employers list and, in 2017, to its World’s Most Innovative Companies list for the third consecutive year. We also earned the Great Place to Work® Certification for the third consecutive year in recognition of our outstanding workplace culture.  Verisk is a leading data analytics provider serving customers in insurance, energy and specialized markets, and financial services. Using advanced technologies to collect and analyze billions of records, Verisk draws on unique data assets and deep domain expertise to provide first-to-market innovations integrated into customer workflows. We’ve been delivering predictive analytics and decision support solutions to our customers for nearly 50 years, helping them protect people, property, and financial assets. At Verisk, you’ll be part of an organization that’s committed to serving the long-term interests of our stakeholders, including the communities where we operate.  At Verisk, you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create a positive and lasting impact on the business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. Our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business will be heard. As key contributors to our success, our team members enjoy working in a business-casual, collaborative environment that offers state-of-the-art resources, advanced technologies, and an excellent benefits package.Job DescriptionThe Enterprise Data Management team (EDM) in Verisk Financial provides end-to-end data management solutions and services to clients in the Financial Services industry. As part of this service, we offer multiple solutions and products related to enterprise data warehouse implementation, data strategy assessment, BI reporting solution etc. Business Analyst will be responsible for gathering requirements, communicating with client, acting as key interface between client and practice teams and supporting project delivery lead to drive and deliver projects. White hat online data detectives with superior analytical skills, strong R skills (or solid Python expertise with the ability to quickly master R) and supervisory or team lead experience: our client is looking for candidates like you to fill an open Data Analyst Team Lead role in their perk-filled New York office. This client has combined machine learning, behavior analysis and groundbreaking technology in an e-commerce SaaS solution that helps prevent fraud, pinpoints genuine purchasers and guides those legitimate users to checkout in order to drive revenue gains.  In this role, youll join the operations team responsible for real-time online fraud prevention, rapid response troubleshooting and customer performance. You will play a substantial role in identifying and analyzing emerging online fraud trends in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. The successful candidate will gain a deep knowledge of company offerings and utilize strong analytical skills to surface actionable insights to our enterprise customers. The Data Analyst Team lead will supervise a data analyst group while also managing their own assigned clients. This is a fantastic opportunity for an online fraud expert to shine in a high visibility, high responsibility role at a leading SaaS firm that rewards its staffers hard work with fully-covered medical/dental/vision coverage from day one, employee stock options, 401(k) match, commuter programs, catered lunches and snacks, team events, Pilates/yoga and more!Primary Responsibilities: Manage a team of four to five data analysts in a highly technical environment, effectively leveraging top tier analytical tools and advanced analytical methods to identify, surface and address data trends and performance issues; directly analyze live data to gain a strong mastery of online fraud prevention  Communicate findings and conclusions in a clear, concise manner to both non-technical and technical stakeholders  Work consultatively with clients and internal colleagues to answer their business questions and needs through data insights  Design, develop and deliver comprehensive technical fraud prevention solutions  Collaborate with internal teams to optimize processes touching on data analysis Required Experience, Skills and Traits: 4+ years experience working with R or Python (e.g., creating functions, wrangling data, etc.), including experience leading a team and working in a client-facing role; expert level MySQL skills; if not yet an expert in R, must be willing to quickly gain that knowledge  Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills  Machine learning knowledge or experience is a plus  Bachelor's or Master's degree, ideally in a quantitative area of study (e.g., statistics, computer science, natural science, mathematics, etc.), business administration or economics  Eligibility to work in the U.S. without Visa sponsorship is required  Occasional night and weekend work is required, to serve a global customer and partner base

Remedy Partners is seeking a Data Support & Solutions Analyst to join our growing Tribe. The Data Support & Solutions Analyst will be part of the Partner Services team tasked with general support of Remedy field operations. Key tasks include ensuring data quality and accuracy to support the utilization of Episode Connect (Remedy’s proprietary EHR software) and Reporting platform, and other administrative support. Why this role? This individual will have responsibility for ensuring availability and correctness of underlying data for analytical reports on the performance of physicians, hospitals, and other health care providers, etc. Primarily, this will entail understanding and improving the flow of data through the Episode Connect Care management platform. In that capacity, this individual will have to marry business analytical, and technical expertise to ensure that the appropriate logic is built into EC, and subsequently understood by the analytical and technical staff who need to leverage it. JOB SUMMARY The Sr. Data Analyst for Revenue Assurance is responsible for maintaining information systems and provide technical support for all aspects of the revenue assurance department. As part of the role this individual is responsible for collaborating in the identification of leakage across the enterprise and coordinating with cross functional teams to drive incremental revenue/profits and costs reductions. The position reports to the Dir. Revenue Assurance. MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Support the RA team in the maintaining and technical preparation of reports/dashboards/trend analysis to inform management how well the company is transforming services into profits.  Serve as a liaison to the Marketing/Billing department and assist/collaborate in efforts related to revenue planning, pricing and packaging, and promotion management.  Partner and collaborate with the Business Intelligence team on automation of reporting and process improvements and other analysis.  Develop and implement revenue assurance applications and processes, including data extraction, creation of data warehouses when required.  Assist with building automated test tools for alerting. Regular review and maintenance of alerting test cases.  Research questions for management and conduct ad-hoc investigations.  Establish and monitor processes and controls to protect revenue and data integrity/synchronization among systems.  Identify and quantify revenue opportunities and coordinate with cross functional teams to realize incremental revenue.  Develop and maintain reporting databases to establish trending to detect leakage.  Perform other duties as requested by supervisor REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS Skills/Abilities and Knowledge Investigation: Ability to perform data analysis, statistical analysis, detailed data tracing, raw CDR review  Baseline Reporting: Ability to manage data warehousing, SQLs scripting for investigation and proof of concept purpose  Network/Systems: Knowledge of a particular revenue management system, extremely comfortable with managements of databases, SQLs queries, data conversions, programs and operational disciplines.  Synchronization: Ability to perform complex data matching processes and data diagnosis across multiple systems.  Correction: Experience scoping and troubleshooting systems and sizing organizational problems, has authority to propose changes.  Ability to read, write, speak and understand English.  Ability to communicate orally and in writing in a clear and straightforward manner.  Ability to make decisions and solve problems while working under pressure.  Ability to handle multiple projects and tasks, prioritize and organize effectively.  Ability to think outside the box and apply critical thinking skills.  Ability to use personal computer and software applications (i.e. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access).  Ability to work independently.  High level of curiosity and investigate mind-set with attention to detail.  Cable television products, telecommunications, monthly recurrent services or cable billing systems experience preferred  Experience with CSG or ICOMS billing systems is a plus Education Bachelors degree (or foreign equivalent) in computer science or information technology or equivalent experience. Related Work Experience Number of Years Advanced technical data experience 5+  Including two or more years of writing advanced SQL, tuning database/  query performance is strongly preferred.  Cable billing systems, telecommunication 3+  Experience with CSG or ICOMS billing systems is a plus WORKING CONDITIONS Office environment  Minimal travel may be required

job1: Central Data Science Solutions (CDSS) Business Analyst or Principal Business Analyst
desc: Job Description - Central Data Science Solutions (CDSS) Business Analyst or Principal Business Analyst (198267)Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment which benefits our employees, patients and communities.Central Data Science Solutions (CDSS) Business Analyst or Principal Business Analyst-198267The qualified candidate  will be hired at the appropriate level commensurate with education/experience. Description: This expert level  Business Support Specialist position ensures the availability of clinical  database and complementing applications to the users, predominantly supporting  the BI region North and South America. The supported systems include the  clinical database management system (Medidata RAVE), the Clinical Data  Repository (such as Oracle Life-science Data Hub system, LSH), SAS-based  reporting tools (such as CARE/RAGe), and neighboring systems (Integrated  Review). User Support for global  applications and the Clinical business process worldwide  Participation in  international software system implementation projects under general direction  of CAS Line Manager and Business Project Responsible.  As an employee of  Boehringer Ingelheim, you will actively contribute to the discovery,  development and delivery of our products to our patients and customers. Our  global presence provides opportunity for all employees to collaborate  internationally, offering visibility and opportunity to directly contribute to  the companies' success. We realize that our strength and competitive advantage  lie with our people. Job Description It's an exciting time to be part of the IFF IT team at our Union Beach, NJ location. With Frutarom combined; IFF is 129 years old, has greater than $5BB Revenue, contains over 13,000 employees, supports 160 locations, serving 33,000 customers with 150,000 products. IFF is transforming our services to meet the heightened expectations of a highly creative, international and mobile workforce.  As the organization is moving towards becoming a leading digital organization, data and analytics are key capabilities that provide insights and decision making. As the Lead Advanced Analytics Engineer, you will be focused on various data initiatives and dabble in different technologies to move the organizational data management and analytics capabilities forward.  You will spend your time Providing high quality solutions that address business needsEngineering Big Data Platform and toolsets for business intelligence and advanced analytics capabilitiesCreating conceptual, logical, and physical architecture for data storage, processing, reporting, and analytics, leveraging emerging technologiesDesigning and implementing a state-of-the-art and user-friendly central data management system Job Requirements Required SkillsSupport system integration of diverse data sources and technologies used in the design, construction, testing, deployment and operations of BI solutionsProvide architectural expertise and long-term vision to build scalable business intelligence platformDocument success criteria and monitor solution effectiveness, including system performance, adoption and other key metrics. Work on Systems integration, including design and development of APIs and AdaptersImplement best practice tools and processes for ensuring data quality to support data identificationFeature creation by working closely with the BI/Advanced Analytics teams on delivering Intelligence and Insights on raw data with Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Forecasting, Advanced Search, Statistical Modeling capabilities, etc.Work with Application teams to build data capabilitiesRequired ExperienceBS degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or quantitative fields5+ years of data analysis, preferably with a technology companyHands on Technical Manager with a strong analytics background, supporting large scale applications.Must have Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Forecasting, Advanced Search, Big Data architecture, Business Intelligence and Statistical Modeling capabilitiesExperience with Hadoop, Spark, Tableau, R and PythonPreferred Experience:AWS PlatformBI ToolsSAS and SPSSLeadership Behaviors: Our business is fueled by a sense of discovery; by consistently asking "What If?" To learn more about the possibilities please visit IFF.com  This position will require the applicant to be in a leadership role focused on various data initiatives. The applicant will be able to work both independently and collaborate with a diverse group of teammates.  Nearest Major Market: New JerseySDL2017
